review_body: We approached the concierge for help to get some trips and places to go. We had not read up on what we wanted to do. we listened to her and choose some trips .  the two other chooses were great but when we lounged a complaint she would not do anything about it  we tried to get her to get us a refund and also she had misinformed us about the limo cost stating it was part of the deal. It was not as per broucher. We found she had given us false information regarding the email addressee of the company involved.. So have not been able to take our complanit any further

We have just returned home from spending a fun filled 9 days in beautiful Waikiki and staying at Beachcomber by Outrigger. Hotel was great very friendly staff and rooms where clean & comfortable. My best experience though was with Malia Akiona who was on the concierge counter. Malia was so friendly and so very helpful that we would find a reason just to go talk to her. Nothing was a hassle or problem and was always so happy to answer our questions or help organise our days. Malia made my stay that more special as I have come away with a friend and will miss our daily talks.

Perfect location, beautiful room with well appointed amenities. Very difficult to find any fault worth mentioning. Amazing view from our room on the 19th floor (deluxe ocean view room). Thank you Beachcomber.

Kristina works in reception and she was so kind and helpful. She made the beginning of my trip quite pleasant. She’s a great asset to the hotel. The hotel has great value as well and is right in the middle of Waikiki.

We spent a week at the Waikiki Beachcomber and was very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were tastefully decorated and quite large. We asked for a partial ocean view and that is what we got. The people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. Check in and out was smooth and efficient. We really enjoyed the pool. The location was great—just minutes from the beach and right next door to the new International Marketplace. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I stayed at the Beachcomber from March 7 - 15 and the hotel is great. Right from the bellhop you the front desk staff to the maids, everyone made me feel welcome. Because tourism is quite low on the island due to Coronavirus, all staff seem to be going out of their way to express their gratitude for the visit.The location is as close to everything you can ask for and the rooms are comfortable. Even being so central, I was concerned about the potential for noise, but generally the nights were quite peaceful. (Much quieter than other hotels I have been at on higher floors) Next time I am in Honolulu, I will definitely keep this hotel in mind!

What an absolutely amazing experience and stay at the Waikiki Beachcomber, great central location, great views over Waikiki beach and Diamond Head from our balcony. Very friendly and helpful staff, the best experience we have ever experienced from all staff. We highly recommend the Waikiki Beachcomber for anyone that wants to stay in a great central location, we stayed in a ocean view room on the front of the building which offered fantastic views.

The hotel, staff, Katzu made our wedding day stay a memorable time. We received excellent customer service from everyone. I greatly recommend this hotel for all sorts of occasions. I will book at this hotel for our next events and relaxation time.. Thank you Waikiki Beach comber.

Had the chance to stay here for two weeks, best time ever! The hotel staff was some of the friendliest I have ever encountered! Our stay started out great when Kiana, the front desk manager, and Joy, front desk, checked us in. They made sure our stuff got up to our room and got us set up for our stay. Our room was amazing with a great ocean view. Arsenia and Myna from Housekeeping left notes in our room saying "Aloha", or just wishing us a great day. Even the valets welcomed us back by name each afternoon when we got back to the hotel. The location is right in the heart of Waikiki, so everything is right near you, but you don't always need to leave the hotel. We spent two amazingly lazy Saturdays hanging out at the pool while the staff at Hawaiian Aroma Caffe brought us coffee and breakfast in the morning, then food and cocktails for the rest of the day! We were totally spoiled! Cannot wait for our next trip!!!

So I’m from Atlanta, Ga and came for a 5 days. I absolutely loooooooved my stay! Kiana the front desk manager, was so accommodating and Jenny was the front desk rep that helped me get settled in as well. I’d give them both 12 stars! And yes I’m a real guest that stayed. You’re right in the middle is EVERYTHING if you stay here. Make sure you get the daily breakfast to save money. All the housekeeping staff were amazing and very sweet! Also, for attractions and events you MUST talk to MALIA !!! She is well respected and knows every part of this island!

Our stay was very comfortable with a great ocean view room. The service at the front desk was excellent when we checked in and made us feel very welcome through out our stay. The house keeping staff are to be commended on their attention to detail and friendliness. Would definitely recommend it and looking forward to returning next February! If I could rate them higher than 5 stars, I would!

Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and from the start to the end we had an excellent experience. This hotel is across the street from the beach in a central location to restaurants shopping etc. (Best location in my opinion and no need to book a hotel that's on the beach). We had Michael check us in and he was awesome the whole trip. He helped us with places to go for activities and tips and tricks in the area. He really went above and beyond for his job. The rooms are very nice, we had a partial ocean view and it practically had a full ocean view. We had breakfast at the Aroma Cafe every morning included in our room package and it was very good. Trolley service was awesome it goes everywhere you need and is included in your amenities fee. Overall a great hotel to stay and good value for the money you pay. The only thing I would warn about is the Concierge that is in the hotel and outside works for Expedia so they try to sell you their packages and do not provide any value to our stay. (ask the front desk for restaurant or activity ideas)

Awesome hotel, great staff. Location is ideal!! Having the Maui Brewing Co in the hotel was great for afternoon cocktails and the live music was really great. Beach is a very short walk and the views from the hotel are outstanding

The best hotel In Waikiki very central close to my fave stores and restaurants. A Clean very nice quiet hotel beautifully designed just got renovated and smells really nice. Maria Fermin at the front desk was very nice friendly and made an exceptional service for me and my family. I am glad I found this hotel I’d recommend it to anyone. And it has a bar downstairs.

We stayed at the Beachcomber for 5 nights. What a wonderful hotel in a perfect location in the middle of all the activity and a short crossing of the road a short walk down the lane and you are at the beach. Cafe and brewery located within the hotel provided great snacks and meals and coffee was great. Bed was extremely comfy, room was very clean and wonderfully presented. We would recommend hotel to others and will happily stay again when next in Waikiki.

The Waikiki Beachcomber looks amazing after the renovation. Friendly staff and such a central location. You can literally walk out of the hotel and find all sorts of shopping and restaurants. Can't wait to come back!

It was a great Hotel & great experience, we enjoyed our stay. Autumn and her Team were helpful. The coffee shop was nice, & the staff was friendly. Close to the Beach, shopping, and easy to get to anywhere In town. Restaurants in the Hotel were good & discounts were available to area stores. We would come back!!:)

Kristina is awesome!When we checked in it was too early, but Kristina tried really hard for us to check-in ASAP.It was really helpful since some of my family members are over 70 years old.I stayed at really expensive hotels before, but you don't need to stay those hotels.Staffs are really nice here, the renovation is so successful.It's right in front of Royal Hawaiian center.Laundry room is clean, gym is quiet and nice.You will get 15% off coupon for the cafe and the restaurant in the hotel.You can also use the Outrigger trolley with your room key!I've never had such a good experience!Love it!! I will definitely come back next year!

As a resident on Oahu for 35yrs, it was a treat to spend the weekend in Waikiki at the Beachcomber. This hotel is clean, great views, restaurants, pool, and lobby shops all exceptional. Great location

This was my first time in Hawaii. I must say that I truly enjoyed myself. “Kimiko” really made me feel comfortable and answer all questions. Beachcomber has everything around you and then some (including several ABC stores)I enjoyed the clean room and comfortable bed. Thank you

OK, I don’t often write reviews. But I have to say this experience here at the Waikiki out rigger hotel has been spectacular! General Mgr Isaac has gone above and beyond making us feel comfortable warm and his entire staff has been as well. Nothing short of spectacular. I cannot stress enough, the staff here is amazing from the doorman, to the parking attendants to the front desk receptionist, to the housekeepers. They are all spectacular! The view from the hotel a spectacular and is quiet at night. Very nice. Thank you again Isaac et al for your attention to detail and customer service

We stayed 6 nights at the Waikiki Beachcomber. The hotel is in a great location, convenient for all that Waikiki has to offer. Our room was clean and comfortable and as we decided to take up the offer of an upgrade, we had a beautiful view of the ocean.Staff here are friendly and approachable. We booked a tour through the concierge (James) who took time to find the best trip to suit our schedule and requirements.Having the Maui brewing co on site is a definite plus - food and drinks selection is really good and not badly priced taking the location into consideration.Would thoroughly recommend a stay here - Only down side to the stay was the Aroma cafe which is situated in the hotel lobby. Food is prepared on a sandwich press - very little choice, slow service and rude staff.

We visited Honolulu for six days as a stopover back home to NZ. I booked the Waikiki Beachcomber based on the great feedback it was getting. As our flight was moved to an earlier time from LA and we were arriving in HNL at 9am and had a 15mo we were a bit stuck for options especially given the early start. I contacted the hotel regarding an early check in with everything setup for our daughter and it was a hassle free conversation. Upon our arrival to Beachcomber, our check in was effortless too, starting with the team at concierge service, to the front desk and finally getting our bags delivered to the room. We stayed in a partial sea view room which was clean and tidy. It was a very new room and spacious. It had a balcony that could be used to go and sit out on. Also it came in handy to dry any wet clothes as well.The bed was a large comfortable king size, the room was well laid out as well. The bathroom vanity area was outside of the shower area which was good in some ways and the shower, toilet were in a separate room. The shower was spacious with good water pressure as well.The Beachcomber is located right on the strip of Waikiki centre and opposite The Cheesecake Factory and a few doors down the Waikiki Centre. It is about a 20 mins drive from the Airport and only 10 mins from the Waikiki Plaza. There is a cafe and the famous Maui Brewing Co located as part of the hotel. There is a rooftop swimming pool also in the hotel however this was quite small compared to the number of guests they get so can get cramped. The beach is pretty much across the road but this is shared by the many of the beachfront hotels so the good spots that can be used by all is about a 10-15 min walk.The hotel does provide tickets (we got ours as part of the package) for trolley buses which picks you up near the hotel and doesthe trip to all major attraction points so you can do things such as the Market, Diamond head peak and more.All in all, Waikiki Beachcomber is a new hotel in a well located area in Waikiki. It has friendly staff and a comfortable atmosphere which allows you to have a great time away.

Check in was a breeze and they upgraded us because we are awesome. We valet parked because trying to find parking is a nightmare anywhere down in the heart of Waikiki. So pay the $30 bucks and spend your time enjoying the pool or having a drink at the bar. This hotel is located right in the middle of everything. Nightlife and fine dining abound. The hotel has a pool and hot tub that is about 30 feet above street level. Get a nice tropical drink and get in the hot tub while enjoying the skyline views and the street activity below. Maui Brewing has a restaurant there that is ok but it is not fine dining by any means. We enjoyed a small lunch there but then when out for diner later that night. The little shop next to the pool has snacks and alcoholic drinks and is open most days until 6pm. We had the breakfast included and this little cafe is also where you get your breakfast. There are select items that you can order for the breakfast voucher but wanted other more expensive items and the were happy to oblige us for a small up charge. Just ask. They also have a Kama'aina rates as well. If you don't know what Kama'aina is then you aren't one.

Oahu's North Shore, Hawaii

review_body: Beautifully renovated hotel. Location is ideal--close to the beach and almost next door to the International Market Place. Service was courteous and prompt. James Speight, the Lead Concierge is friendly, humorous and extremely helpful. Had a great holiday, in part because of the awesome hotel experience.

Renovations are outstanding - excellent décor, very fresh and beachy feel; All staff we dealt with were amazing; food outlets (both) were fantastic. Location couldn't be better. Pool area very pleasant and great atmosphere. Staff are exceptional and should be congratulated for enjoying their jobs so much

I have stayed in Waikiki in the past and this is my first time staying at the beachcomber. This is one of the best locations in Waikiki, right across from the beach. The staff was very attentive and friendly. They really make you feel at home. Can't wait to come back and stay again. 10/10 would recommend!

This hotel is tops in every way but recent renovations make it particularly good for senior travellers. The bath is not slippery! There are grab rails as well and a waist high area for soap and shampoo. No fear of slipping or fumbling for shampoo while washing. The shower itself is best ive had in USA. Aussies are used to great showers. The bathroom is so well lit. You can see everything including what your makeip looks like. The room is also excellent for lighting with multiple options. Two gooseneck reading lights over the bed were fabulous .. no stretching or fumbling for hidden switches. My last hotel was so dark i couldnt see what i was packing. Room and especially bathroom are spacious and there are 2 chairs to sit up to the table. Again most rooms have one. The balcony is also spacious and chairs clean and comfortable. My bed was great and the pillows perfect. This is my 8th trip to Hawaii so I'm used to the Aloha Spirit but this hotel has EXCEPTIONAL staff. From arriving very late and tired and using my walking cane.. thank you Kyle .... to reception and cleaning staff. Ultra friendly and helpful. This is directly across the road from Cheesecake Factory, Coco Cove and ABC are a few steps away and you can walk through a short lane directly onto the beach immediately across from the hotel. I don't regularly stay in WaikikI but my experience has been so good here I'd absolutely return. There's also a free hotel trolley not too frequent works fine with a little planning.

To reiterate what others have said, the Beachcomber renovations are outstanding. Upon arrival in our room, the bell boy took a good 10 minutes of his time to explain everything about the hotel and our room - this is something I had not experienced before and an excellent personal touch.There was a notice outlining that elevators were currently being upgraded and apologies - this was not an issue - we did not find the elevators slow.Our Deluxe Ocean View room was outstanding, super comfy beds, huge TV and quality amenities.All staff were super friendly throughout our 8 night stay. The Aroma Cafe does great coffee and is a busy hub in the mornings, so a little patience is required.Location, location.....what can I say, everything is easily accessible by foot or bus.Restaurants get busy around dinner time, so best to book in advance. Thank You to all Management and Staff at Waikiki Beachcomber - keep up the outstanding service.....we can't wait to return next year!!

While the Waikiki Beachcomber was a lovely hotel, there are many things that could have been tweaked and done better! The Expedia Concierge in the lobby is an absolute scam and is a poor reflection on the hotel. I was talked into the helicopter tour because "it gave the best view of Pearl Harbor." It did not and the whole experience was awful and a scam. This is a very poor reflection on the hotel! Choose your concierge staff better or get them out of your lobby! The elevator situation is a disaster - you must show your room key to use the elevators. While this could be a nice safety feature, it actually creates more problems. People are in the way while others are trying to get on and off the elevators. Also, if there is security there, they should help prevent guests from cutting in front of other guests waiting for the elevators! This happened multiple times per day on every day of my stay.The pool is tiny. The service at the pool for drinks is abysmal. The rooms are lovely and the bath products smell wonderful! The front desk service is rude. I stayed 2 separate times - at the beginning and end of my trip. I paid to upgrade my room on the front end of the trip and on the back end, asked for a courtesy upgrade as I now had a car and was paying parking and valet fees. I had also spent a significant amount of money in the hotel each time. The front desk agent just laughed and refused to answer my request. The hotel had a lot of availability and I didn't think it was unrealistic as a repeat guest to ask for a courtesy upgrade since I was already in a fairly expensive ocean-view room!

We arrived on the 29th December 2019 and stayed for 18 days with my husband and 2 teenage boys. We were here before the renovations 2 years ago and as soon as we arrived the place looked amazing.The front desk staff were all great but our favourite was Kristina she was by far the BEST because of her bubbly, helpful, friendly personality.The outrigger designers have put in so much effort into the decorating of this hotel, every floor has a special feel about it.We were given a map of where the free Outrigger connection Trolley goes and believe me we used it everyday ( just present your room key) you just need to be staying at an Outrigger to use it .We also felt really safe with the hotels 24 hour security guards making sure only hotel guests were allowed to use the lifts We were on floor 8 room 810 overlooking the ocean, we couldn’t have asked for a better room. Everything was renovated beautifully we even had a coffee pod machine, ironing board and iron.And our fantastic, friendly housekeeper Maricon was a superstar and grabbed me a soft pillow when I told her that the pillow was a little too firm, she had our comfortable beds made and room sparkling clean everyday, we didn’t want to leave she made us feel like part of her family.Another mention is to the manager Ike Crockett that handed us a letter while we were there, on behalf of all the staff with their heartfelt condolences regarding the devastating bushfires in Australia, And a BIG, BIG thank you to James at Concierge and Tammy in the cafe.xxxTHANK YOU, it was really comforting to know you were all thinking of us.We will definitely be coming back to visit our Beachcomber Ohana.Mahalo

We recently stayed here on our way home from Canada,it is a great hotel. The decor was lovely,the rooms are fabulous,the staff were so friendly and helpful and we had a fabulous view from our room. There is a lovely cafe connected to the hotel which opens at 6am which was handy when we needed an early breakfast before going to Pearl Harbour

We have visited all the Hawaiian islands and stayed in many hotels, good, bad and ugly!O’ahu, is our favourite island, we have come and stayed at the Beachcomber for over 28 vacations (including our honeymoon over 31 years ago!)The Beachcomber is a wonderful place to stay; friendly, attentive to your needs, clean and modern rooms, fabulous views and one of the best central locations in Waikiki!The recent renovations has made it that much better, without doubt their greatest assist is their staff at every level.From the fellow taking my golf bag to our room to the cheerful ladies who keep our room spotless, all of them are like old friends that we are happy to meet again.Beachcomber is our home away from home!

The rooms are modern, beautiful and comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located on the main street and accessible to the beach and restaurants. It's fun to just walk around. I did not give this hotel a higher rating because of the hassle we had to go through to get a decently located room. Originally, they had us in a room on the 2nd floor. My "city view" room was a view of the roof and all the air conditioning units. At first, they couldn't do anything for me and gave me some chocolate. After escalating to the manager, she found a couple other rooms and we ended up on the 7th floor. According to the manager, I should have called the day before to get a better room.

Large family group of 9 we had booked 3x ocean view rooms on the top level(2500, 2501 and 2503) conjoining rooms that are great for families. First of all the rooms are beautiful, functional, modern and extremely clean. The hallways to our rooms were bright and clean. I could probably hands down say that the rooms are nicer than the big hotels across the road on the beach as we have stayed many times at them all. Which for us made up for the fact we weren’t staying on the beach. It didn’t even matter and was still a fantastic location. The house keepers were always lovely, patient and understanding with our babies nap times. The pool area is lovely but as expected like most hotels in Waikiki the pools are small. Not a deal breaker because your right across from the beach. Love that the hotel has laundry facilities on the parking level because I’m not a fan of bringing home dirty laundry or having damp clothes all through the room. A big THANK YOU to the staff for retrieving an expensive baby swimming costume that flew off the balcony and onto the roof because we didn’t secure it properly. Only a couple of negatives the front desk staff were not that pleasant or welcoming which was disappointing. We found them quite patronising and would suggest that maybe they take a leaf out of their wonderful housekeeping staffs books that will make a massive difference in their customer experience.The escalator leaving the hotel going to the street was out of service the entire time which meant you had to wait for the lift which was always busy. However overall I would highly recommend staying here it was a great stay.

The renovations are beautiful! The designs on the wall and decor make it feel like you’re truly away on vacation. The location is right in the heart of Waikiki with lots of things to do around. From shopping, restaurants, and going to the beach everything is walking distance from the hotel. Will definitely be back again!

Great location, close to everything, one street back from beachfront. We stayed for for 6 nights over New Year's, a Luxury Escape. Everything was exactly as described, very happy with our room with an amazing partial view of the beachfront - our verandah was also the perfect spot to view the fireworks away from the crowds. Breakfast each morning was good, limited choice but staff are to be commended on their service considering how busy they were - I always found each of them polite and happy to serve. All staff at the hotel were friendly, special mention to the lovely Marilyn who went over and above to service our room, and ensured everything was perfect during our stay. Nice pool and atmosphere. All round it was a great stay and I would certainly recommend this hotel.

We have just returned from spending 8 nights at the Beachcomber and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Location was perfect, above Macy’s, across the road from the Cheesecake Factory etc.PRO’SLocationFriendly StaffSafe. Security Staff monitoring who enters the hotelClean modern roomsCONSWe booked a luxury escape package for 2 adults and 1 child but our room on arrival only had 2 double beds so the bed was a bit small for a couple. We would have preferred a queen and a single.The luxury escapes package included breakfast but we were told the child (14) was only entitled to cereal or toast and no drink! I’m sure they could throw in a small juice or a hot chocolate for the children?The aroma cafe was just ok. We had breakfast there daily and our orders were wrong on numerous occasions. We also spent some time there most afternoons and found the happy hour cocktail list never changed in the 8 days we were there. Would have been nice to see a bit more variety at happy hour.Having stayed at Trump and Embassy Suites in the past we think the Beachcomber was a nice place to stay and we would stay there again, I just would book direct with the hotel request a larger room and have breakfast elsewhere.

We have had a lovely stay at this hotel, I always knew it was on the main road across from beach when I booked it and checked it’s location so didn’t expect full on ocean view rooms and descriptions of partial view is exactly what we had from our balcony. The staff are all so friendly and the rooms spacious modern and so clean, the staff cleaning the rooms are so tidy and ever so friendly, we had three rooms for our family all on same level and we will definitely come back as it is so central to everything, beach is across the road all restaurants are a so close. You don’t need a car just catch the trolley around Waikiki and walk everywhere else. Thanks to all the team at Waikiki beachcomber by outrigger we have enjoyed our time Away!

The rooms are nice sized and colorful and pretty. The pool and spa is salt water. The pool is small but the jacuzzi is AWESOME! It houses lovely shops and a coffee house that delivers wonderful cocktails to the pool but the Maui Brewing Co. is a real gem. The BEST brewery anywhere and happy hour to die for. Food fresh, locally sourced and delicious. Between here, Dukes across the street, the Blue Note concert hall Macy’s next door, tent discount Hawaiian shopping on the other the and then the international marketplace just down I was in Heaven. Oh and Waikiki Beach is across the street. You won’t get the fancy ocean views per se but walk across the street and enjoy them in person and save a ton!

We have travelled to Waikiki several times and like to book different places based on newness, location, and the ability to accommodate our family of 5. Recently renovated, the two bedroom suite was large - 1200 sq. ft, 2 bathrooms, 3 balconies. I couldn't find much info online so I will detail this review with photos. I was happy it was a corner space with West views of Diamond Head and South views of Kalakaua, and the beach. It is on the 19th floor and views are obstructed with the Moana Surfrider and Sheraton in front but still nice. The front balcony is traffic noisy and the last bits of sunset are unfortunately blocked. On the plus side, New Years Eve fireworks were right in front of us - clear view from a barge in Waikiki Beach. The Beachcomber is not luxury, but a quality 4 star. We were happy with what we booked for the large space and convenient/central location. Elevators were busy. At the time we were there (peak season of winter break) Waikiki was super packed with tourists and felt more like Vegas or Times Square rather than peaceful paradise. Was super glad to have rental car to escape and explore. Enjoy and Mahalo!

My wife and I stayed at the Beachcomber hotel after hearing about its recent refurbishments. The rooms are beautifully presented, modern and above all clean! The service received from the staff overall was great! A special mention to James Speight from the Concierge who assisted us in planning our activities! James was helpful and knowledgeable and gave us the best insights into planning our day. Above all though, James’ kind and friendly attitude made him so approachable and easy to talk to.

Upon checking in to another hotel in Waikiki, that room was not fit for me and my family to stay at. The rooms were not clean, the furniture was old & broken, and the bathroom looked like a public restroom, not a hotel bathroom. I had to get out of that hotel at all costs. I only made a reservation at this hotel because the Waikiki Beachcomer was already sold out. I walked over to the Waikiki Beachcomer, a hotel that I've stayed at before, and went to the front desk and spoke with Kiana, the front desk manager. I told her my situation and she worked with me to see if there were any available rooms that night, my first night in Hawaii. After 30 minutes, Kiana found a room that was available for the duration of my vacation so I booked it. I went back to the other hotel to cancel my reservation there. Though I had to pay a penalty for the cancellation, it was worth it to get my family to a quality hotel to make this vacation a memorable one. I especially want to thank Kiana for her outstanding customer service to help me and my family get a room here and enjoy our stay at this hotel. She made sure that all of our needs were taken care of. The location is in the center of Waikiki, where you get get to many restaurants and stores to shop at. The rooms are clean, the hotel is clean, the hotel staff is friendly and willing to help you any way they can. I will stay here every time I visit Honolulu!

Booked a oceanview suite. When we arrived our room faced the city (could see no water from in the room). I questioned the oceanview room to be told the view is only from the balcony (we didn't book partial view) . The balcony doesn't even face the water and was so tiny and unpleasant you wouldn't go out there. The room is clearly not a Waterview so don't be conned if that's what you think you are paying for. The elevators are terrible and slam shut. I was hit so hard by one my coffee spilt all over me and the lift as I walked in. The pool is small and was usually crowded. The front desk staff are very friendly and the best part of the place. The room is nice enough but thinking we had a Waterview for our holiday and being what I believe as tricked really turned me off. Location is good but there are plenty of other options where you actually get a view from your ocean view room. We won't go back simply because I don't like The dishonest approach to categorising their room. Others may be happy here knowing ahead of time what to expect.

Great centrally located hotel , very convenient, a stone away from everything in Waikiki, above Mach.. Beach view, very friendly staff, quiet though hotel was fully booked.. will definitely come back to stay!!

Our family of 10 stayed one week over the new year holiday period which was probably one of the busiest times to visit. Location was convenient — very central and easy access to just about anywhere in Waikiki: shops, restaurants and nearby sites. The Coco Cove general store is a few doors down and provides most of the usual essentials you’d need on a beach vacation. We enjoyed the excellent staff hospitality at the front desk, Maui Brewing Company, Aroma Cafe, housekeeping, bell captains and concierge. The kids loved the pool which was small but adequate for keeping them entertained. Our cheerful and energetic concierge at the Expedia desk, James Speight helped to arrange surfing lessons at Big Wave Dave’s as well as a one-day Eco Island Tour with Hoku Tours which took us to other scenic spots on the island. Overall, a pleasant kid-friendly place stay and well worth it. Many thanks to the team!

We spent a fantastic weekend in Waikiki at the Beachcomber and absolutely loved this hotel! Recently renovated and beautiful rooms and facilities, excellent and attentive service, and perfect location all add up to a phenomenal Waikiki experience! Will definitely come back and highly recommend this phenomenal hotel to everyone!

We arrived on the 27th of December 2019 for 11 nights me and my husband after a long 20 hour flight from the U.K. To this hotel which is centered on the main Waikiki strip right across the road from the cheesecake factory we have never stayed in this hotel before because we normally stay in the outrigger reef But we thought we would try something new and I’m so happy we did when we checked in we spoke to kiana she was extremely helpful with everything she informed us a lot about Waikiki beach and the hotel, she was so sweet this hotel is Spectacular it’s All newly renovated i was shocked on arrival the lobby is beautiful with 3 Hawaii themed Christmas trees :) I booked the Luxury Escapes Promotion which I did not really no what it was until I arrived we had free breakfast in the aroma cafe which has the most amazing homemade waffles & is centered in the main lobby with free trolley passes & free beers in the bar which I was over the moon with, when we went to our room I was gobsmacked for how beautiful and large it was with a very large balcony with sea view the interior in the room was amazing very large king size bed with massive tv on the wall the bathroom we really big to plenty of space to put you essentials if you have not stayed in this hotel before please do it’s perfect in everyway I give it 5 star alllll the wayyyy ! :) and I’m really enjoying my stay I don’t want to go home but I will most definitely be coming back :) and I can’t wait x x x x x x Olivia :)

This place is so cool and compared to what it was before, a run down dump, I can’t believe the investment they did in this place. I appreciate and cool modern vibe that they throwing out there but the bestest is that the Maui brew co is in the lobby

Beachcomber by Outrigger is perfectly located, close to all shopping , food courts and transport.All staff were very helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this accomodation while staying at Waikiki, accomodation is very reasonable.we will certainly stay here again next time we visit from Australia, we travelled in a group of 6, 3 grandchildren , and we were allotted connecting rooms which was terrific.

I’ve stayed at a lot of hotels in my travels but Kristina at the front desk is outstanding. She handles crowds and questions with a smile! They should clone her to work at all hotels! Mahalo, MikeThe hotel has been renovated and is right on Kalākaua and easy walk to everything.This is primarily a Japanese tourist hotel so it’s VERY busy and there’s often a wait for an elevator

We stayed here with two friends, from 24th November to 3rd December 2019.Initially we had some problems with the rooms we had booked, which were not suitable, but the front desk clerk, Kristina soon organized two fabulous rooms facing the street with great ocean views for us. Nothing was too much trouble for Kristina, she was so helpful and friendly, a great ambassador for your hotel.Thank you Kristina for making our holiday so wonderful. We will be back !!!

The hotel is situated perfectly on the main strip of Waikiki, making everything you need either in walking distant or available on their Outrigger Trolley. The facilities are all clean and well maintained. The rooms have been updated recently and the two restaurants on site are fantastic. The pool is a little small, certainly a hotel pool, rather than a resort. Views are good depending on your floor location. The staff are all extremely friendly and helpful.

We had a wonderful Holiday at the Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger hotel. The hospitality was outstanding during our stay & we would especially like to thank Maricon from housekeeping who looked after us on the 8th floor & provided us with exceptional service for the duration of our stay, her professionalism & dedication to her job made our stay more pleasurable. Thank you Maricon & the staff at Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger, see you on our next trip to Hawaii , Mahalo ❤️

Loved staying here. The location was perfect, walking distance to everything you could want. Staff were super friendly. The rooms were clean and the beds comfy. It was such a convenient spot, we will definitely Choi’s this hotel again when holiday Ing in Waikiki. The only thing we didn’t like was the air conditioner... it was so noisy we couldn’t sleep with it on... and it was hot out.

" We stayed at the outrigger to celebrate our anniversary it was such a beautiful, nice hotel, workers were very helpful, the rooms were so clean ,comfy ,very relaxing great view of Waikiki. I would recommend this hotel for anyone staying on Oahu its conveniently located right on the strip of Waikiki.

Location is big for me when I pick a hotel and the Outrigger is right in the heart of Waikiki next to many shops and restaurants all in walking distance. The rooms have a modern feel and a great ocean theme to them. We had an amazing room with not only ocean views but mountain views as well. The staff were excellent and always had a warm smile everytime we interacted with them, true aloha spirit. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to be right in the heart of Waikiki but still have a beautiful quiet, relaxing room to go back after your fun day of shopping or swimming at famous Waikiki beach. We will definitely be returning next time we go back to Oahu.

My husband and I stayed at the Waikiki Beachcomber again as we came in from the outer islands to do some Christmas shopping and celebrate a birthday. What a great place... the front desk checked us in quickly but was very personable. They remembered my husband and I and welcomed us back! There was a box of chocolates and a card from the hotel recognizing our return! How sweet!! Our housekeeper was amazing and although we were there for a quick weekend, she smiled and spoke with us each morning. She asked if we were celebrating anything special and made us feel like we were old friends. The warmth of the staff is just amazing. From the time we arrived to our departure, we felt like we were amongst family. Kudos to the management team as I know how difficult it can be to set the goals then train to achieve them. Overall, a very nice stay! Definitely coming back again!

A friend from high school and I came to Honolulu for a concert and treated ourselves with an extra day's stay. The Beachcomber staff were wonderful and accommodating. And even when we had a problem with the television (which turned out to be a cable provider problem) their 24-hour tech staff made sure to check in with us when the problem was resolved to ensure our satisfaction. The rooms are beautiful and our view was awesome!Mahalo!

This hotel is located right across from the Cheesecake Factory so it is very central. The rooms are clean and neat but nothing special. We arrived early and they charged us $US50 to get an early checkin so we were off to a bad start. After that the service was good and you felt very safe.We took a Luxury Escapes deal and the breakfast was very limited. If you didn't like waffles for breakfast there wasn't much for you. We ate elsewhere. the pool is small but not used much anyhow. Most people were in the spa because it wasn't so hot.Overall it was fine but we would try somewhere else next time.

This is ideal if you want an ocean view but dont want to pay for the hotels right on the beach. The rooms are fine. The reception area isnt worth giving a 5 rating, Its pretty basic. But I didn't want to spend 500+ a night. The beach is right across the street. Not only did i get a great ocean view, I was also able to see the main street and the action of people and things happening. I would stay at this hotel again even though I like the other Outrigger hotels right on the beach.

I was very happy with my stay at Beachcomber by Outrigger. My high level room had a beautiful view.The rooms have recently been refurbished and have a lovely ambience and a nice bathroom. It's in a great location in the centre of Waikiki, short walk to the beach and directly above Macy's. Staff are friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

This hotel is in the centre of town and within walking distance of the beach, restaurant and shopping. The Maui Brewing co is right downstairs and convenient for a drink or quick meal especially during happy hour. The room was spacious and comfortable. The down side was breakfast, it is in a cafe in the lobby. I found the food to be average without much variety, the main choice was waffle or bagel and a coffee. I wasn't impressed by the quality or freshness of the food and skipped eating here a couple of morning to find something fresher to eat. The hotel elevator was out when we were there but that doesn't reflect on my opinion of the hotel as it will eventually be fixed. I also thought that for such a large hotel the pool was tiny but I suppose the beach is within walking distance but you need to get there early to book an umbrella. I didn't have a problem with noise but we were on high floors. We used the car park which was convenient. Overall a good hotel that in a great location.

The Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger was an amazing place to stay! Very friendly and inviting. Clean and fresh hotel/resort. In the greatest location. The Beachcomber is in the middle of it all... shopping, beach access, restaurants and transportation, all on it’s doorstep. I would definitely recommend staying here, plenty of amenities including a pool, spa, cafe and convenience store/gift shop and more.The next time I come back to Hawaii (hopefully very soon), I will be coming back here to stay!P.S, if anyone knows what the music/artist is who is played in the lobby of the Beachcomber, please let me know. The ambient chill music is lovely and I’d love to find it and play it at home.Thanks!

My first comment about anyone thinking of coming to Haiwaii is beware you will need to bring plenty of money, it is very very expensive , made even worse with US Aussie$ exchange rate and 20% tipping, so when you eat you can add 50% to the price. We were paying Aus $10 for a cup of coffee!!Hotel itself in a Great position right in the heart of Waikiki, opposite the Cheesecake Factory which everyone knows if they have been before. Mauii brewing company is part of the building as well with direct entry from hotel. Quite small pool so dont really consider this as a resort hotel, pool nice for a quick cool off. Generally excellent hotel, staff all good, rooms well looked after and comfortable. Small cafe/ bar in lobby serving pool area and lobby not bad coffee( for an Australian). Only complaint was it was very noisy on occasion. Bins got emptied in side lane very early and also next door had party on balcony until 2.30am and then got up early to leave a couple of days later and they sounded loud enough to be in our room. But you are coming to the party part of town in guess.We wont be bothering to come back until exchange rate gets back to at least dollar for dollar, as it is terribly expensive for what you get.

Beautiful rooms, Incredible Coffee and Amazing Beers at this Newly renovated Property! Perfect location right in the middle of Waikiki, close to everything. Staff was Wonderful, from my first interaction with the Bell & Valet, check in process at the Front Desk was super smooth, and housekeepers were super friendly. I am already planning my next trip back!

What an amazing place to stay on the islands! It has all the amenities that you hope for in a hotel and they are still implementing new and exciting things to do there! Don't miss out on staying here! It's worth every minute of vacation you have!!

The title of my review says it all! The room was clean, comfy & quiet. The location is within walking distance of everything great about Waikiki. The service was wonderful...aloha all around. Highly recommended!

Having recently stayed here for 10 nights, I highly recommend this hotel. Great location, spacious rooms, clean, quiet, good value. The lifts are being renovated at present, so can take a long time for the lifts to arrive but the hotel does warn about this in the lobby...The downside that we and others we spoke to encountered was the pool area, with children being able to run around the slippery surface, dive bomb splashing numerous patrons and take over the spa with out parental intervention. What was worse was that the hotel did nothing when large groups of adults took over the pool areas, intimidating other guests so they could take over the pool and play games. The hotel did not intervene. Many other guests we spoke to felt like they could not use the pool and went to the beach instead. Convenient market in foyer, cute trolley that is free for hotel guests, only runs every 1 1/2 hrs on loop. Attached brewery is $$$ but can be nice for a meal or drink. Yong, house keeper did a great job.

We recently had a 6 night stay at the Beachcomber as part of a Luxury Escapes package from Australia, which was good value for Hawaii as it is an expensive place to visit, The deal include a partial ocean view room, free wifi, breakfast at the café, beer samplers at the brewery, travel on the Outrigger trolley and included the hotel resort fee. The room was clean and comfortable and had a good bathroom and shower. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room on 10th floor was also quiet at night and did not suffer from street noise. The hotel is located in perhaps the best position in Waikiki as it is in within easy walking distance to everything. The Outrigger trolley was also good and gave access to most areas and also went to Diamond Head and Ala Moana shopping district. You can also catch the Waikiki Trolley Pink Line To Ala Moana for $2 each way.The main concern for us was the costs in Hawaii as unfortunately you need $1.50AU for $1 US so it made everything 50% more expensive,( and then extra the tipping cost as well which many services needed ).We did have an enjoyable stay at the Beachcomber and give it a good recommendation

A really nice place to stay on the main drag of Honolulu. It’s 5 minute walk to beautiful Waikiki beach and in the middle of the main shopping strip. The rooms are lovely and clean and best of all they’re quiet. You might hear an occasional door close but that’s it! No noisy neighbours. Beds are comfy, bathrooms are clean. Nice place to stay.

My family and I stayed at the Waikiki Beachcomber to celebrate my son’s birthday. First let me just express how wonderful our stay was that weekend. The staff were great, as always, greeted from when we first arrived until the last day of our stay with great and positive attitude. Secondly, their pool is so kid friendly that my son and nephew never wanted to leave whenever we would use the pool in the facility. Even I enjoyed the pool and even I didn’t want to leave. Lastly, I must say, the location is the best! It is right in the heart of Waikiki, Kalākaua to be exact, and it is close to many different shops and restaurants that you can visit. All within a walking distance. Feel like eating ramen, sure it’s right around the corner, how about Chinese, ok yeah it’s right across the street, oh Japanese oh yeah sure it’s right around the corner or have the crave for pasta, oh yes, it’s literally right down stairs. If you want to enjoy a few cold beers or cocktails or even some coffee or tea, they have a bar and a coffee shop right at the lobby. Another great addition to this hotel is the convenient store they have right next to the front desk, where they have most of the things you need. Like drinks, snacks and ice cream! Like I mentioned in the beginning, our stay here is always great! It makes it worthwhile and it’s one in the books that’s for sure!

Beat place for a staycation and vacation! I loved it here. The whole hotel was very clean and organized. All of the staff were very helpful and caring. Our room was always cleaned every night we went back. The house keeping staff were outstanding. They’re very friendly. I loved our view. We were in the center of Waikiki and I loved it. Everything we needed to go to were very close. Walking distance. I can’t wait to come back to his hotel again. Definitely recommend this place for everyone!! You won’t be disappointed!MAHALO!!

Our family of five enjoyed a 2 night stay at the newly renovated Waikiki Beachcomber. It is perfectly located right in the middle of Waikiki so everything is conveniently at your doorstep. Our room was available for us when we arrived from our early morning flight which was greatly appreciated. We had breakfast at the hotel’s flagship restaurant Maui Brewing Co both mornings which we really enjoyed. The pork belly Eggs Benedict and avocado toast were delicious. Plus they have a good kids menu. We also visited for Happy Hour which is great value for an early dinner as appetizers and pizza are included. One morning, we took advantage of the complimentary Outrigger shuttle and hiked up Diamond Head. The shuttle can also take guests to the Ala Moana mall. I enjoyed partaking in the morning poolside yoga class ($10 fee). The kids loved the pineapple candies provided on our last night. Thanks for a great stay.

I agree with many reviews that this hotel is in a great location, rooms are very well appointed and of a good size; everything you would expect from this level of hotel. However, we were disappointed with a few aspects. Firstly, we arrived at about 11:00 am after our overnight flight from Sydney. We knew check in time was 3:00 pm but I did ask if we could check in early. We were told this would be possible if we paid about an extra $US50. I think that is a bit of a rip off - the room was already ready and may well have been the room we were actually allocated for a 3:00 check in - what is the justification for the extra charge? No display of goodwill there. The Aroma Coffee shop is in the hotel complex, adjacent to the pool but we could not charge anything from there to our room - that should be changed. There was one Concierge who really did not have much knowledge of the area; we asked for advice late one morning where we could get an omelette breakfast to which he replied we were too late for breakfast in the area - really, we had a delicious omelette breakfast 10 from where he was sitting - Maui Brewing Co, part of the hotel! On our last day the entire pool area and Maui Brewing Co was closed for a private party. So for one quarter of our stay we could not utilise the two best aspects of the hotel. There was no mention of this when we checked in or to anyone prior to that day - very poor. I was extremely annoyed and after complaining at the front desk I was offered a refund of the Daily Resort Charge, $US34. I believe everyone in the hotel should have been given this discount - two of the main resort facilities were unavailable all day! Finally, in an email I received from the hotel asking for feedback on our stay I mentioned all that I have done here. In response I received a stock standard generic reply from the GM, Ike Cockett - how impersonal and very disappointing. It's a pity these events left a sour taste re our stay in what otherwise is a very good hotel

My wife and I stayed here for two weeks just recently and we were very happy with both the hotel and the location. The rooms were very well appointed, newly refurbished and a good size. We both particularly appreciated that the shower was not over a bath! The hotel is next door to the International Market Place, across the road from Waikiki Beach, within walking distance of 4 of the Waikiki Trolley stops. We ate across the road at the Cheescake Factory, down the road at the California Pizza Kitchen or down Duke's Lane at Duke's Lane Market & Eatery, just to name a few places. Of course we also had meals at the Maui Brewing Co, and at Aroma Cafe, both of which were withing the hotel complex. There was also a small shop that which was competitive to the ubiquitious ABC stores around town. I also can't fault the staff at the Hotel. The following section shouldn't be considered criticisms of the hotel; rather they are bits of info that a traveller probably should be aware of. We had an Ocean View room which overlooked Kalakaua Avenue, and eventhough we were 12 floors up, noise from the street and particularly the Maui Brewing Co outdoor bar area filtered up to us fairly unhindered. Therefore, if you are sensitive to street sounds etc, perhaps book a partial ocean view or Waikiki view room. Also, to be fair the sounds died down by around midnight most nights. I'd aso suggest that the Laundry be expanded. There were only 3 machines and one was out of order the entire time we were there. Last year we stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki Resort across the road directly on Waikiki beach, and to be honest, I'd prefer to return to the Beachcomber on our next trip back to Oahu, whenever that happens.

I was part of a large group of 19 x golfers from Australia. We stayed for 4 x nights and had a great time. The hotel and rooms were exactly what we needed and the location is perfect. Organising this trip was seamless thanks to Lauren and all the staff were fantastic.We cannot wait to return!Evan JonesSydney, Australia

I have stayed in Waikiki, Hawaii a few times but this was my first time at Beachcomber.On reading good reviews of their recent renovations we decided to try.We opted to pay more for a Seaview and higher floor and it definitely was worth it.We loved the decor, bed was comfy and rooms were large and fresh and bright. Lifts were a bit old but they were in the process of getting upgraded I believe.The bar downstairs had great live music in the afternoons during happy hour and we also loved the cafe tucked away from the Waikiki hustle and bustle. Very lovely staff and we would definitely stay at Beachcomber again. I found it competitively priced compared to other hotels we have stayed in.

This was our first stay since Beachcomber went from IHG to Outrigger. We' stay here every year for Halloween festivities because of location and IHG head always been good to us. Well Outigger was super too!My husband made the reservation in July apparently with his ihg points thinking it was at beachcomber since that's what we've been doing all these years. Well when we arrived of course clerk couldn't find our reservation. Thankfully they had rooms available so we were able to book and get our Halloween on. Next day we wanted to stay an extra night so we asked at front desk if they had availability. Not only did they have but they also kept us in the same room! Everything was so easyand smooth Thank you for that!All staff support friendly from front desk to valet and everyone! The only downside was elevators are suuuuper slow. We waited about 5 minutes and when car arrived it was jam packed. Waited a long time for next one and it too was packed. The guy waiting with us finally took the stairs down. We finally got on the THIRD ELEVATOR after waiting about 20 minutes total.Other than that very good stay.

I rarely write reviews of hotels even though I travel a lot. I was so impressed by this hotel that I have to include some words.The location is great and not so great -- depending on what you want. It is right in the middle of the main street in Waikiki so is handy to everything. BUT there is no beachy feel -- it is not beach front and doesn't feel it. It feels more like a boutique hotel than a beachside resort. Not a big deal, but worth mentioning if that is important to you.The pool is also on the tiny side. From what we saw in Waikiki this is usual -- but being from Australia we are used to resort pools that are huge and have hundreds of sun loungers, especially at the Aussie Outriggers. This is a square pool, the kind you would find in a city motel, and there are buildings in the background. Again, not a big deal -- but if you are looking for a more resort style hang, this is not your place.Now that those things are out of the way.....the hotel itself has reopened with a plush reno about 5 months ago. Maybe they are trying hard right now, but it is just top notch. The staff at the desk go the extra mile to be helpful, courteous, give you advice about Waikiki and Honolulu. The luggage staff are mixed -- they are nice, but a bit sleepy. Our bags weren't even in our room when we had checked in 6 hours earlier. The room itself is a highlight. We also stayed at the Outrigger across the road for a night early in our Hawaii holiday. It is positioned perfectly on the beach and has a bigger scale holiday experience within it, but that building and the rooms are tired and musty and old. The rooms here at Waikiki Beachcomber are among the nicest I have stayed in -- fresh, modern, beachy, spacious. It is a delight.Again, the staff make this place-- congrats to you guys on your wonderful team.

The housekeeping department during my stay was very helpful and excellent in cleaning our room.. I was very satisfied and can absolutely recommend it to my relatives and friends and will definitely come back to the same hotel when I visit Hawaii again. Especial mention to Loida for being extra nice to us..

Once again had a great and memorable stay for 5 days for our group of 12 last week.This time we brought the whole family and enjoyed the property (pool, Aroma Café, Maui brewery). Kudos to Virgil our room attendant for 5 days, very friendly and did a great job! Can't wait till next year to use our 2 free nights for winning their Picture contest! Thanks WBC!

Great service , friendly staff smiling face of Miss Sam , complete amenities,the place has a great deals on rooms and amenities ,good job for janice , loida and a courteous lady name Evelyn ..aside for a convenient location for the designer brand and restaurant. Overall I highly recommended this place Waikiki Beacomber by Outrigger..Will come again to this place...

Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger is a excellent hotel to stay at. We got to the hotel after a long flight a was greeted by Michael at reception, although we were early, he was very accommodating in getting us a key to use the restroom, hold our bags and to contact us when our room was ready, which didn’t take long. All staff from the housekeeping, reception, bells desk, lift security were all friendly, helpful and had excellent customer service. We had breakfast at the Cafe located in the lobby and the Açai bowls were delicious, so was their iced tea. Staff working there were all extremely friendly. The convenience store in the lobby was reasonable price, no more than going out onto the street to buy some food and drinks, which was great to have that convenience in our hotel. The pool was a beautiful place to relax, spending lots of time there. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Beds are quite small for 2 people in them but very comfortable. We also got a roll away bed some nights as there was 3 of us just for a bit more sleeping space some nights. We had an ocean view room which was great looking out to a nice view relaxing on the balcony most afternoons. Staff at the bells desk were lovely and we were sent off with the best farewell. They offered us a seat as we waited for our transfer, spoke to us about our visit, helped load bags in the car. Thanked us for staying at the hotel and hope to see us again, was a great send of to a excellent stay at this beautiful hotel.

My sister and I just returned from a wonderful trip to Oahu. We switched hotels to Waikiki Beachcomber because our first hotel did not give us the “vacation feeling” we were looking for. We wanted to check out Beachcomber first before making the switch and Kristina at the front desk was so kind and accommodating to let us preview a room. We actually stayed at this hotel 9 years ago before the remodel, and we were so impressed by the chic and fresh room style/decor and the wonderful customer service that we were sold on switching hotels, even if it meant it would cost us a little more.On the day we checked in, we were greeted by Sophia at the front desk who was equally kind, accommodating, and professional. She answered all of our questions with patience and a genuine smile. We witnessed Sophia and Kristina being consistent with other customers throughout our stay.The pretty and serene room/bathroom truly made our stay relaxing and enjoyable. We loved the furniture designs and color choices in both the room and bathroom. The beds were super comfortable and while the pillows were too thick for us, I made a call to Housekeeping for lower pillows and they brought them up to us right away. Alicia, our housekeeping staff, added to our great experience by being so positive and friendly.Whoever is recruiting/training the hotel staff is doing an awesome job since everyone from the front desk to housekeeping staff to the valet parking attendants displayed excellent customer service. We would like management to know how much Sophia, Kristina, and Alicia have made our stay that much better. Along with the beautifully remodeled room and bathroom, the great customer service really enhanced our stay and we would definitely recommend Waikiki Beachcomber!

Thank you for another wonderful stay at the Beachcomber. This was the 7th time we have visited Waikiki and our 7th stay at the Beachcomber. We love the now look you have created for our favourite hotel. We had the most wonderful housekeeper on level 8 for our stay. Maricon always greeted us with a smile everyday and was absolutely amazing at keeping us clean and tidy for everyday of our stay. We hope to see Maricon again, we plan to visit Hawaii and the Beachcomber again next year.

Repeat guest since 1975...Always an excellent experience at Beachcomber Waikiki. I cannot count how many times I stay here. Fabulous always! Clean, comfortable, always accommodating. Premier location without walking miles and miles to get where you are going. My award for best employee is ASHLEY AGUSTIN....She is always more that willing to help her guests at all times! I flew for Delta Airlines for 31 years, and have stayed at many hotels. Regardless of “ star” ratings....Beachcomber is my favorite ( do not feel relaxed in massive loud hotels ) I enjoy the very short walk to the beach, and availability to all the restaurants and shops’Marian Robertson

Very happy with my stay at this hotel! It felt very modern and well designed, rooms were very nice, and we had views of Diamond Head and the ocean! They have a great restaurant downstairs and a cool little cafe for breakfast as well. Definitely recommend if you want to be close to everything in Waikiki.

I stayed at the Waikiki Beachcomber with a party of 15 guests for business purposes. The rooms, the services and the location were ideal. The front desk staff was always extremely helpful. Very special thanks to Lauren, the group manager, Florancia and Alicia who made their very best to help us throughout our stay!Hope we'll come back soon!

Very good hotel in fantastic location. The partial view double had lots of room and was well appointed. We had excellent service from the staff member that checked us in and out - she was very helpful and accommodating. We’d stay again and would recommend to others.

Great location. Our 2 bed, 2 bath apartment overlooked the shopping district and beach so it was easy to decide when to go for a swim, when to eat and when to shop. The Concierge, James was terrific in helping us organise activities for us and our 3 teens. The room was super comfortable and well serviced. Overall, great value for money. We will definitely go back.

Hotel is centrally located in the Waikiki shopping zone across the street from the beach. Save hundreds not being on the beach. Nice view of the ocean from our partial OV room. Reception was welcoming and efficient. Our room was clean and bathroom well appointed. The mattress was a bit worn therefore uncomfortable. The pillows were made of thick foam sponges. They were very uncomfortable causing a headache. We slept without pillows. Our room included breakfast which was ok. The Aloha Cafe provided a very basic breakfast with a coffee or juice. If you wanted anything extra there was an up charge.They do charge a resort fee per night but nothing we could use.

We just arrived home after spending 9 nights at the Waikiki Beachcomber. We enjoyed everything about our stay and would love to go back in the future.The Beachcomber is located in the heart of Waikiki and our room had a nice view of Waikiki beach. Our room was always cleaned beautifully and housekeeping staff were (overly) generous with towels, toiletries and other accessories. In fact, every staff member we met were friendly and couldn't do enough for you to make your holiday extra special. The friendly staff at Beachcomber were a highlight of our stay.We also felt safe with security being quite visible in the hotel and no access to the floors without a key card.The pool was quite small and this was the only downside to our stay. The pool was always over run by children and although they were having fun some of the things they were doing were not safe and no one (including their parents) stopped them or even looked like they cared about the impact their games were having on other guests. (They also took over the spa on many occasions) They tiles around the pool are very slippery when wet and I slipped twice although I did not fall - this could be very dangerous, especially for older people.We enjoyed breakfast and drinks at the Aroma Cafe, although service is a little slow and my daughter enjoyed nights at the Maui Brewing Company. We also ate once at the MBC but there are better places to eat at as better quality and affordability can be found in other restaurants close by.The Waikiki Beachcomber is located near Waikiki Beach and within walking distance to major shopping areas. Their trolley and public transport stops are also close by and easily take you to all other points of interest.Overall the atmosphere and friendly staff at the Beachcomber helped make our holiday memorable and I highly recommend staying here. We will be back when return to Waikiki.

The room is Big and Clean !The location is opposite to the Apple store and The Royal Hawaiian, ie. in the centre of Waikiki !The service is outstanding ! The Housekeeper on the floor are friendly !The TV are very big and New !

Fantastic hotel the best location. The rooms are beautifully decorated very beachy. The only fault I could find is the pool. As I have a disability the stairs in and out of the pool are very slippery as the step from the pool to the deck in very high even with the help of a rail. The tiles are very very slippery which caused me to fall. But otherwise the hotel and staff are great.

Loved the newly renovated room , we stayed on the 18th floor , the view is absolutely beautiful ! We loved our room very much. housekeeper did really good job , the bed was clean and neat ! Front desk agent Michael checked in us was friendly and gave us good info about the hotel facilities. Free shuttle provided from the hotel was convenient!

We spent 3 nights at the Waikiki Beachcomber, very good location, friendly staff, the only thing to watch out for is rooms that are on the left side of the building (left side if you are looking from the front of the building), there are a number of large air conditioners on the roof of the adjacent building, they go 24/7 and make quiet a noise. The views from the front rooms are very good, good restaurant / brewery and swimming pool all part of the same building and the beach is a very short walk, we enjoyed our time there

Our first time at this hotel, we drove to the garage valet area- it looked like someone’s patio- beautiful setup with comfortable chairs n plants.The valet person was friendly and very helpful as he showed us the elevator, The front desk personnel greeted us with a smile and welcomed us, informed us about the wi-fi, and different activities going on at the hotel while we were there.It was easy to get to our room, the room was beautiful, clean n spacious, love that amazing view of the ocean...I would book The Waikiki Beachcomber Hotel again for my next vacation, friendly and caring personal at its finest....

We stayed at the Beachcomber on our way to North America and on our way home. Hawaii was a great stopover to break up a long flight.Checkin was a breeze, fast and efficient even when we arrived in after 9:30pm, which still gave us time to duck across the Road and have dinner at the Cheesecake Factory after a long flight from Vancouver. Our room was clean, spacious, great views and the bed was comfy. Close to the beach and restaurants, very friendly staff. Great way to start and finish our North American adventure.

The staff was extremely knowledgeable, courteous, and professional. They were aware of my birthday! Everyone from the front office to housekeeping were extremely efficient in the duties and exceptionally friendly. I would most definitely come back as well as recommend friends and family to the property.

It was an awesome stay at this newly renovated hotel! The Aloha spirit was everywhere beginning with the helpful valet parking attendants, the friendly front desk staff & the caring attitude of the room attendants. The management staff also greeted us. We felt so very welcome!The room was so spacious & very comfortable! We had a beautiful view of the ocean & the ewa side of the island. The decor was gorgeous with some nice amenities.This is the best Outrigger hotel in Hawaii we have experienced!

Have stayed 5 times now even during renovations. Always an excellent experience. Rooms, position, service and employees friendly and very helpful. Would strongly recommend to anyone. Central location close to beach and shops ideal.

I loved this hotel!! The staff, rooms, and everything in between was so wonderful! The thing I liked the most was how they give you free rides on the buses to Ala Moana and Diamond Head, which also passes by the zoo and aquarium. They also have a nice pool that has a bar beside it and nice shaded seats. It was my husbands first time to Hawaii and the hotel gave him a wonderful and lasting impression of how Hawaiian hospitality is like. It is right across the beach as well, and right next door to a flea market. Everything you need is in walking distance because it’s in the middle of the strip! That was the game changer for my my family and I, because my son loves the beach and water so much and I loved to shop, and with how much we had to carry, it was super convenient!The only downside was, because we had a child in a stroller with us, the elevators were located in the back where the garbage was. They did try to mask it though! The hotel is located at the 2nd floor above Macy’s. But it’s really not that big of a deal! Would definitely book there again with the fam!

Right in the heart of Waikiki. The new renovations are very modern and chic. Its nice to have Maui Brewing right in the same hotel.This is my favorite Outrigger Hotel! You will truly love staying here.R

Spent 9 nights here in September 2019. Had a good experience. Good location, close to beach and right in middle of plenty of shops & restaurants. Hotel room was the cheaper “Waikiki view” room, which was located on 7th floor. Had ok view for cheap room with glimpse of ocean, lots of sun on balcony but mostly faced a neighbouring building (located quite far away - maybe 50m away). Bed was comfy, room was modern with nice shower, big screen tv. Mini fridge was noisy though, had to unplug it to stop a constant ringing sound. No room service or minibar etc. lifts are very slow for some reason, can sometimes take a minute or two for the lifts to reach your floor when you call for it. There is a small shop near check in desk which provides some basic drinks/food, not cheap but handy. Pool looks small in photos, but actually was quite pleasant as not many guests seemed to use it, and the jacuzzi beside the pool was a nice place to soak at end of day.couple of eateries/bars in hotel which are ok to eat/drink at. Another good bonus - outrigger run a trolley service which provides free transport for hotel guests which takes you on a Waikiki loop for free which stretches from Ala Moana mall to diamond head, very handy. Hotel is also near main bus stops to catch tours etc, and also near public routes which allows very cheap transport to popular Honolulu tourist attractions (pear harbour, outlet mall etc) for only $5.50 return. Uber cost was between $20-$25 to and from airport to hotel.

We have stayed at this hotel 8 times now. This is the first time after all the renovations. The place looks amazing, so luxurious and beautiful. Bed was so comfortable. Loved the bathroom renovations as well. Plenty of lighting.

Hotel and rooms are newly renovated, perfect location... walking distance to best restaurants and to the beach....service was excellent!! Our bellman Jon was amazing full of aloha and one of the nicest person i ever met in Hawaii.

Fantastic location. Close to the beach and the shops. Great staff. Beautiful rooms. The only con is that they need to improve their service and choices in Cafe Aroma. There is always a long queue in the morning and it takes ages to put your order in. Also depending on who the barista is, coffee is not always good.

This is my first time back since the renovation and this hotel was just fabulous! The rooms were spacious and the beds comfortable. The location was ideal and the staff were so gracious and accommodating. Even though the staff were busy when we were checking in they still managed to make us feel special and welcomed. We absolutely loved our stay here and can't wait till our next stay at the Beachcomber! A huge thanks to the staff for making our stay such a memorable one. Mahalo Beachcomber!!

Love this hotel. Have stayed here a couple of times now. Rooms are lovely, clean & comfortable and well appointed. Staff friendly & helpful. Great location with everything you need just a short walk. Would definitely recommend.

They got this all right: service, ambience and room decoration. Felt luxurious and special. Lovely lanai with spectacular views of Waikiki beach. Location is great, just across the road access to beach but also to shopping, restaurants and night life. Highly recommended for Honolulu experience and still luxurious but not as highly priced as the hotels on the actual beach.

We would like to compliment you on your new renovations very nice indeed....the rooms are just beautiful.... I also have to make a special comment on the cleaning staff who make this holiday worthwhile especially Alicia who was our housekeeper for 10 days..... there has been some negativity about the lifts, but to be honest not much has bothered us, as in any hotel at prime time lifts will be busy..... we liked the new security in the place made it feel safe..... overall the place cannot be faulted..... come and enjoy the friendly and helpful staff from Reception to Porters at the Beachcomer....Brian Linda O’Neill 420......

loved our visit. Beautiful updated rooms. Convenient location near beach and excellent shopping when you’re tired or sunburned! Eateries at the hotel and nearby are a great variety - fast food to 5 star restaurants. Staff is great!

Very welcoming hotel once we drove up to valet. Check in was smooth, hotel room was clean and fresh very spacious. Maid was super sweet and kind. Restaurant and pool area was awesome. Walking distance to canoe race was easy. We extended our stay just because we had a great time at the Beach Comber. We choose your hotel for our stay at next year canoe race. Mahalo nui! Head Coach WCC.

Great, friendly and knowledgeable people. Awesome location, very near the ocean/beach. There are tasty places to eat there and nearby! My family and I would definitely come again! And definitely recommend this hotel!

We visited the Beachcomber for a week and received coupons for breakfast at the Hawaiian Aroma Cafe while staying there. Our stay at the hotel was great, it’s in a prime location and all the staff were great! The only let down was the Aroma Cafe located in the hotel. Firstly, the process to order food there takes soooo long - the person taking orders is so slow causing excessive lines (waiting up to 30 minutes just to order). The second day we asked to upgrade our breakfast from what the coupon provided and they charged $20 US for us to upgrade from a ham and cheese croissant to two eggs on toast. By the time we got to the fourth day of our stay, they decided instead of bringing our food to the table they would call our numbers and everyone would collect their food (lack of constancy, obviously just doing what they felt on the day as on the fifth day only every second person had their coffees brought to the table).For four straight days, we were told the 12 oz acai bowls were included in the coupon (which we did and then paid $3 to upgrade to a 16 oz), on our second last day they decided that we would have to paid full price for a 16 oz and pay $3 to upgrade to a 12 oz. They totally messed up our coffee orders on most days and the food (lack there of) included on the vouchers seems to be a con to just get you to spend money on upgrades at their cafe.Do yourself a favour and skip this cafe when visiting the hotel.

Beautiful hotel! The service was awesome and the staff were very friendly and helpful. My family loved how there was many places to eat near the hotel. Also, there was many places to shop.Very trendy hotel with beautiful rooms. The bar seems to be popular, it was busy every night we were there.Can’t wait to stay at Waikiki BeachComber again.

You could not ask for a better hotel. I loved the location. The hotel is across the street from the beach. Great restaurants and shopping is just an elevator ride away. We had a good time at Maui Brewing Co., in the hotel. Really good food and beer. I had a bacon avocado burger that was so good I ate it three times. The staff was very helpful. Everyone went out of there way to help make our stay more then we could have hoped for. We will definitely be back.

Recently stayed at this great hotel and must tell you how much my family and I enjoyed the atmosphere and staff service! The hotel was very recently renovated and upgraded...the views were fantastic and the location was very centrally located in Waikiki (right next to the world famous International Marketplace) and the staff provided top notch HOSPITALITY! And room rates were very reasonable especially considering their location is in central Waikiki! A definite MUST STAY!!!!
