Stayed at the Waikiki Beachcomber and what a transformation from what it used to be! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Located central to everything in Waikiki, it was a great base to venture from. The city lights at night from our 23rd floor room were breathtaking. Can’t wait to come back!

This hotel recently underwent a major refurbishment and what a fantastic result was achieved!Style and class plus without the loss and and sense of Hawaii and its people.Staff are fantastic, very friendly and helpful from the Bell desk to house keeping and everyone in between - CongratulationsThe central location of this hotel is one that you have everything at your doorstepShops, restaurants and activities and literally seconds from dipping you toe in Waikiki Beach Great for families, couples and singles.This hotel is a definite must stay when you come to Waikiki, excellent value for money !Five Stars from me !

I would highly recommend this hotel the Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger to those traveling to the islands. General Manager Ike Cockett was personable along with the entire staff from the Valet,front desk staff Christina,even the security personnel at the elevator were pleasant and professional. The rooms were clean,bed comfortable and the views outstanding...especially during the evening sunset. The extra touch of a welcome card,a box of chocolate,bottled water was really going out of their way. Spent some time at the swimming pool basking in the sun and relaxing. When traveling,took the time to work-out on the 2nd floor exercise room. Great location down Waikiki to stroll the streets for shopping or checking out eating restaurants. Stayed for the weekend and planning to come back again soon.

Stayed here for 4 nights on the 24th floor. Had an ocean view room and the view was spectacular. Being on such a high floor we had very little traffic noise from busy Kalakaua Avenue and the room was clean and tastefully decorated. All of the staff we encountered were courteous and friendly. There were no tea making facilities in the room but after enquiring where we could get access to hot water we were supplied with a kettle. This was much appreciated as we always take our own tea bags when travelling anywhere in USA. Location was amazing, just step out the front entrance and you're right in the heart of Waikiki. We had read reviews saying the lifts could be very slow coming up to the floors but we never found this a problem on our visit. Would certainly stay here again.

Awesome location right in the heart of Waikiki , nice rooms very modern , all new amenities in room , the only thing that was a downside was that housekeeping would come around at around 7.30am so if you like a sleep in make sure you put do not disturb on your door

I highly recommend this place especially for Kamaaina. They went above and beyond from Valet to Housekeeping to welcome us and make our stay enjoyable. The entire staff were more than helpful and never treated us any different from the Tourist. We were all treated the same.  I love the fact that for Kamaaina they do not charge Resort fees, which personally as a local think is ridiculous. We already pay high to live in Hawaii let alone get charged 30.00 plus per day Resort fees for silly things like High speed internet (not planning on staying in the room all day), access to gym facilities(Really?), limited and restricted discount coupons to places we more than likely will not go to because WE are on a STAYCATION and can find better deals elsewhere and some other irrelevant nonsense which again will NOT benefit a local like me. This Hotel is nicely remodeled, clean, located in a perfect location and next to the New International Market place, Macy's, Footlocker, ABC store and much more. Very convenient. Mahalo BEACHCOMBER for a wonderful weekend.....P&D Canne

Refurbished room on 23rd floor at the back of the building. pretty quiet yet only 200 yards from all the action. Loved the brewery downstairs and whilst a large hotel still found a spot around the pool to relax. Hope to go back again.

The Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger is the old Holiday Inn with a fabulous facelift! All of the common areas and rooms have been completely renovated and so everything is really fresh and new. It is located smack bang in the heart of Kalākaua Avenue close to the beach, close to all of the shops and attractions of the main strip. You could not get a more convenient spot. The hotel has a driveway off Kalākaua Avenue and valet parking, so really easy if you’ve hired a car and need to come and go. Rooms are a good size for Waikiki, and on higher floors will have a great view. Our room on 22nd floor faced Diamond Head and had a great ocean view. Lovely beach decor, comfy bed and a well designed, very new bathroom. Great service from everyone we encountered, our room was refreshed with complimentary bottled water daily and we enjoyed eating breakfast at the in-house café. The pool area is smaller than some of the other hotels but perfectly fine, the café serves meals and cocktails poolside and there were ample lounge chairs and towels available. There was also a hot tub/spa.Overall, for the price the Beachcomber is a great choice in Waikiki. We have stayed at the Moana Surfrider and the Royal Hawaiian, which are more expensive and have the advantage of being right on the beach. But the lower price point of the Beachcomber makes it a really attractive option in Waikiki.

This place was nice because I could use points to get nights.I would not come back if I had to actually pay for a room. There is nothing special about this place except it is centrally located and very close to the beach (Across the street is a passage to the beach between the street's buildings.

Close to everything. View from our room was fantastic. The newly renovated rooms are spacious and welcoming. Added benefit that the rooms have chrome cast so can stream Netflix etc and also videos that you had taken. Staff are helpful. The Hawaiian Aroma Cafe was great for breakfast. Pool was a good size and the happy hours at both the Hawaiian Aroma Cafe and the Maui Brewing Company were good too.

Perfect with an awesome view. Plus it was between the beach, the best restaurants and the shops... I recommend to book here for your vacation in Honolulu!! (plus the breakfast spot inside the hotel it such a nice place to eat an acai bowl!! Right by the pool!!)

Convenient location and recently refurbished to a very high standard. Nice reception area with mood music and a great smell! Rooms modern, very clean and tastefully decorated. Staff helpful and accommodating - even though we arrived earlier than the published check-in time, we were allocated a room straightaway and our luggage arrived at the door at the same time we did. We stayed for a week and thoroughly enjoyed it, although Waikiki itself was very busy at the time of year. An excellent hotel for the price and one which I would certainly use again.

We stayed in the 3rd week of July 2019 at the room 2010. We really enjoyed our stay there and think it good value for the price. (Positive)- Super convenient location. It’s located in the middle of city centre. We had very good access to shopping, the beach and the rent-a-car office. We feel that we really enjoyed Waikiki city centre. City centre is noisy all the time but we stayed at around 20th floor, then basically it was ok.- Great view. We had very nice view from our room. We saw the blue ocean and the city at the same time. Attached is the view from our balcony.- The room seems to have been renovated It was modern and clean.- The receptionists we met were all friendly and polite. I had very good impression on people there.- Our plan included breakfast. The breakfast we had at the Hawaiian Aroma Caffe was excellent. (Negative)- it was just one night though, big noise at like 2 am from the outside annoyed me. There seems construction or repair near the hotel, though hard to believe at such late night. I heard big noise something like winch system working. Such kind of things may be inevitable in the city centre.

location is perfect, the only thing is trying to drive up into the hotel, people on the street aren’t paying attention! But room was beautiful, the staff were all so friendly and helpful. I loved my stay, and I’ll be back.

Not accommodating at all, We arrived at the hotel at 7am in the morning as the flight from Australia arrives in Honolulu really early in the morning, we asked the reception staff for a room and early check in, I worked in hotels for 8 years and the number one rule for us was always to do everything possible to look after our guests, we waited in the lobby from 7am until 1pm for one room. During this time we had seen a large number of people checking out right in front of us, you would think that just one of those rooms could have been cleaned for a guest that had traveled for 12 hours and had not been able to sleep.... but obviously that never happened. Once we made it to our room we were placed in a room that had work been carried out in the corridor , there were 3 fan machines making a loud buzzing sound all day and all night, making it hard to fall asleep. we requested a room move and the manager suggested that the only room available in the hotel was one with two single beds in it..... right !!! On our last night we were woken up at 1am by the person in the connecting room trying to get into our room, I got up banged on the door and screamed "what are you doing" he closed his connecting room door and exited the room going down on the lift. And to top things off today I checked my credit card to find a charge of $50 USD for no reason at all as there's no mini bar.

My husband and I stayed at the Beachcomber when we were in Waikiki for work. The hotel is gorgeous! Totally modern and comfortable. The Beachcomber is steps away from all the restaurants our friends recommended and steps away from the beach. Because we were in town for work, I was nervous that getting our car and loading it would be difficult but the bell desk staff were amazing. They were up within minutes of our calls and loaded our car for us. The cafe was adorable and the food was great. The pool was beautiful.We’ll stay here next time (with our kids!)Could not recommend the Beachcomber more highly. You won’t be disappointed.

Stayed 3 nights and all was outstanding. Beautiful room, very clean, great on-site restaurants, perfect location for Waikiki shopping at upscale shops and sightseeing. Lots of evening activities and restaurants nearby. I would definitely return to this property!

The Ocean View rooms (Diamond Head Facing) suffer from air conditioning noise from the building next door. The noise is so loud that you can't open the balcony door during the day/night or even enjoy sitting out on the balcony to enjoy the view. The breakfast facilities are very average at this resort with Aromas serving a quick fast food experience rather than a good buffet experience, the other option is Maui Brewing which you can enter from the hotel, again the breakfast experience is average as well. Room air conditioning is noisy and temperature control is poor. Rooms are reasonable for a hotel of this stature.

Such a great hotel, anyone coming to Honolulu needs to stay here. The best location right on the main strip of Waikiki, hotel is right opposite the Cheesecake Factory and the Apple store. Next door in the lane is market stalls and the other side/joined is the international market place.The rooms are beautiful since being upgraded, our room was upgraded to an ocean view and well worth the money for the view, if I had paid.The new pool deck is also a great place to chill in the afternoon if you don’t like the beach. Staff are all really kind and helpful!Please stay here and support the outrigger beachcomber!!

We had an ocean view room with King bed, and we were blown away by the decor, the comfort, and our view! The friendliness of the staff is beyond compare. They genuinely care about helping you have the best vacation ever. The beach access is right in front which made it so easy to go back and forth if we needed to (we had our 4month old with us, and needed frequent breaks from the sun). We ate and drank multiple times at the microbrew there, since the food is AMAZING. Overall we stayed for 2 weeks and did not want to leave! I highly recommend this hotel! We will definitely be coming back!

A friend and I stayed at Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger for a week and we loved it! The location was perfect and close to everything we needed including shopping, the beach and transport to see the sights. We found the hotel staff to be friendly and welcoming and the housekeeping were amazing. The room was very clean and modern and the beds were very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here again in the future.

Ok, so I travel quite a bit for my work. I think I have a good grasp of what should and shouldn't happen at a hotel from my experience and this one just rattles me still. This is all from my own experience.1. There was a fire at this hotel. I know this isn't the hotels fault. However, the customer service during the fire was atrocious. People staying at the hotel were ushered out of the hotel late in the evening. Many of them had robes and pajamas on since a lot of families stay here. No representative was available to give updates or to provide a place for families to stay temporarily. There are several Outrigger locations and a banquet hall could have been opened for people to at least sit and let children get some sleep. Many parents had small children and were forced to shop or find a small bit of waikiki that was comfortable enough for a toddler to sleep on. No updates were given. Instead guests shared information with each other when the doors were reopened at almost 1:30am. I was one of those parents and I ran into several others in the same predicament. After the fire, no recompense occurred and a simple chain letter was slipped under doors. While I don't expect much the apathy of the hotel chain was unacceptable.During the next few days professional cleaning crews were present to get rid of the smoke smell and whatever else they do. They were awesome! They were professional and went the extra mile to assist guests in the hallways. Personally they held doors open and offered to take garbage from people they saw in the hallways. The hotel staff in comparison only cleaned the rooms and not any other areas of the hotel. Since elevators were affected due to the cleaning and fire escapades we had to to utilize the stairs. For two days I saw the same wet soggy toddler socks and an empty Starbucks coffee bottle in the stairway leading from guest rooms to the lobby. It wasn't picked up and the stairway was never cleaned as far as I could tell.Additionally, the night we returned to our room we had to pass security because someone had broken into the room next to ours while the fire escapades occurred. It happens, not much you can do about that in a fire. However, there was no proactive response for several days. On our third day at this location, and two days after the fire there was a security guard posted at the elevators that were now working. Never was there a security guard posted at stairways that all guests had to utilize to gain access to their rooms during the prior two days. This is unacceptable. Additionally, only the main lobby elevators had a security person in-place. Please update your security to provide a safe haven for guests. There is better security measures at hotels that cost less.Lastly, the escalators were needing maintenance at this location on my last day here. I usually don't care, but when there are multiple fails this just adds to everything. Instead of doing the maintenance at night or maybe doing the down escalators after the check-out period (they shut them down without notice at 0700 when I was leaving) they had shut them off at the prime time for people to check out and leave. Kind of a pain when you are trying to depart. Not to mention we had to show our receipts to the security guard, who just saw us depart the elevator to check-out, in order to get back on the elevator for the ground floor (lobby is on the second floor).Please improve your processes, cleanliness, and improve the customer service at this location. It's a nice hotel don't let it tarnish the other outrigger locations.

We have had a 6 night stay. Smack bang in the middle of Waikiki, close to everything, this is a great place to stay. All the staff are very friendly, and the cleaning staff are wonderful. Most importantly, the rooms are spotless and the beds are really comfortable. The Beachcomber group also has a free Waikiki shuttle bus driven by friendly, informative drivers that will take you to all of the main attractions here. The beach is a short stroll across the road and down Dukes walk. The Aroma cafe is a great place to have breakfast - the Acai bowl, fresh waffles, or bagels are a great way to start the day. We spent several pleasant evenings on our lanai gazing at the sunsets or watching the people strolling up and down the boulevard. Altogether a lovely stay.

Travelled to Waikiki from Australia a few times now and this has been the most impressive hotel by far. Rooms are modern/clean, the setup is perfect. Pool/Cafe/Bar all within a few steps. Had family and friends who stayed as part of our wedding party and they were over the moon. Front Office Staff and Housekeeping where very helpful.Mahalo

We had such an amazing time at the outrigger in Hawaii. The people were so lovely and our cleaner Elisa was so lovely and did such a great job. We also had the most amazing concierge James who was so attentive and looked after our needs and knew all the amazing places to go eat, book cars, cruises etc. He went above and beyond and made our stay so memorable with his guidance and help. Outrigger is very lucky to have such an amazing concierge to help their guests on a daily basis. Thank you James for a wonderful experience on our first time in Hawaii.

It was our first stay at the Beachcomber we Loved our experience! Rooms were very clean and perfect size for what we needed. When we checked out I left my sons two favorite sleep animals in the room...I realized this and called the hotel that night. The first man to answer the phone was absolutely No help he brushed me off to an answering machine. I immediately called back and spoke with a woman at front desk who put me directly through to Housekeeping. I spoke with Florencia and she was so kind her and her co - worker Alan went Above and beyond and searched for my sons stuffed animals !!! It’s people like them that make your hotel amazing! The next day I went to hotel and picked up my sons toys from the Housekeeping manager Evelyn, she was so kind and totally understood! The Housekeeping department Rocks, they probably work the hardest of all staff and it shows ! Thank you Florencia, Alan, & Evelyn in Housekeeping at Beachcomber Waikiki by Outrigger

The hotel lies in the heart of Waikiki, so we can go in several minutes wherever we want to, but not so expensive. It is also clean and comfortable. In the hotel lies Aroma Cafe, which I like best of all the coffee shops in Waikiki that I know.

The location was perfect!!!! Right on the main strip of Waikiki!! The hotel has been renovated with modern facilities. The pool area although a bit small was really nice with the cafe opening up onto it. For the price compared to other hotels nearby, it was really good value for money and I would definitely recommend it and be coming back on future visits.

I had a wonderful stay here.place has just been renovated and now rates a 4star.spacious room,comfortable beds.Great staff,nice cafe in lobby called Aloha(how odd)lol,Great place to eat if wanting a smaller breakfast,Cheap as chips too.Afternoon Happy hr too. This opens up to poolside so you can eat drink and laze all day.

This hotel is a great value option that is still literally across the street from a great beach. You do not need a car which is great because parking is ridiculously expensive. The hotel is new and close to great restaurants and shopping. It has a lovely pool and cafe (not part of hotel but inside) and then a separate hotel restaurant which is also great. The cafe was perfect for my boys and I who don’t always want or need the big American breakfasts. The decor is really fresh and contemporary. There is no room service and our room had no view but we didn’t need either. A really great option in Waikiki so you can spend your money on other things while still feeling like you are in a really nice hotel.

My husband, our 16 years old daughter and myself had a delicious lunch at the restaurant located at the ground level facing the ocean. The staff were courteous and helpful. The meals were good in size and flavors. Great location. We recommend this place.

We just came back last night after staying for 7 fun days. Room was clean, Staff were very friendly, always have a smile and very helpful. I would like to say thanks to your staff Florence who is with the house keeping crew who was so helpful. We really enjoyed our stay. We would also say thanks to the ground crew staff who took care of our luggages, and the parking attendants.

Love the newly renovated rooms and lobby. The redesigned pool very cool. Love the Aroma cafe and had a couple of great meals at Maui Brew. Definitely plan to stay at the Beachcomber on my next Waikiki visit.Front desk staff very accommodating and housekeeping friendly. Love the valet service and the staging area when waiting for car delivery.Thank you Outrigger. Many wonderful memories at the Beachcomber in the HEART of WAIKIKI

I recently stayed at the Beachcomber by Outrigger in July, it's affordable, new and the staff is very helpful! Tatiana that works for housekeeping was AMAZING. She was so great and always such a joy to see in the mornings

I stayed at the Beachcomber by Outrigger for 5 nights in a ocean view deluxe room July and loved it. My friends were staying at the Outrigger across the road, so I wanted to be close to them and the beach. The room fitout is modern and gorgeous, the bed was uber comfy, the hotel had beautiful local artwork throughout and my room had lovely views towards diamond head and over the royal hawaiian. Very quiet, I didn’t hear any noise from neighbouring rooms. The staff were attentive, helpful and friendly. Anita from house keeping looked after me beautifully. The Maui brewery company restaurant downstairs was a great spot for breakfast, dinner or a late takeout, and we had some fun nights at the Duke over the road. You are in the centre of everything and it’s great people watching below and feeling the Waikiki vibrancy from the comfort of your lanai, or wandering across the road for a swim. The elevators were a little slow, but it didn’t bother me at all. The elevator from the street was out of action one night so we had to go through a side door to the stairs, but we were guided through.Highly recommended.

We recently stayed here for a couple of days while our house was being repaired. It was a nice surprise. The hotel was very modern and clean. The front desk staff was excellent. The rooms were spacious and very clean. I understand this hotel was recently renovated. The location was very convenient to eating establishments and shopping. The International Marketplace is a few doors down and Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center is across the street. The pool area was very small, but had a nice pool and jacuzzi. Parking is valet only, but very conveniently located. All in all, it was a very nice hotel. I would highly recommend it to anyone. One other note, don’t eat breakfast at Maui Brewing Co. in the lobby of the hotel. They have really slow service. It took me 20 minutes to get a toasted bagel. There is a big sundry store next door that you can find quick breakfast items.

The hotel was fine, the people at the desk were very helpful. It's only 1 block from the surf, so cheaper than hotels closer. But try not to get a room that overlooks other buildings (outs had no decent view at all). Good clean rooms. The coffee shop is a great and happy place, excellent for coffee and breakfast. The attached restaurant (Maui Brewing Co), while not cheap, is a plus. The pool is tiny.

I attended a dinner show on 16th July 2019. The meal was OK and fairly enjoyable. The dinner show that consisted of a magician, Polynesian dancers and fire dancers was exceptional. I have traveled the South Pacific fairly extensively and without doubt in my opinion, it was by far the best show of this type I have attended. I would definitely recommend this event to visitors in Waikiki you'll not be disappointed.

We loved the location of this hotel, central to everything. Our room was very clean and comfortable and serviced daily- unfortunately due to the noise from the air conditioning, we did not sleep as well as we have at other hotels (tried turning it off and got too hot). In saying that, we would happily stay here again.Mahalia the Expedia staff member out the front of the hotel (down the escalator) was awesome and ensured we got to experience the best Hawai’i had to offer.

I loved Hawaii, the people, the things to do, the ocean and the hotel. Beachcomber was great, we were on a budget so we couldn't get a larger room but the stay was great. We got the partial ocean view room. The staff was very nice, very helpful, friendly even, the location was perfect for everything we wanted to do. All the activities around the area, beachcomber is the perfect location to get there within minutes. I'll be back Beachcomber!!! Thank you!!

Just returned from 6 amazing nights at The Waikiki Beachcomber with my husband after booking through Luxury Escapes.( must give Luxury Escapes a wrap too).We booked a ocean view king bed room with breakfast and couldnt be more happier.We were in room 1409 after Ashley at reception said it was a great view and we'd be happy there.She was spot on.We had 3 really good water views and beautiful sunny afternoons on our verandah to enjoy them.Ashley Sam Kristina and Sophia at reception could not do enough for you.They were friendly efficient and always greeted you with a smile.They found out through Luxury Escapes it was my birthday and its like the whole hotel new and celebrated with me.I was given chocolates by two different people.I loved that.The whole place has been completely renovated and it was fresh beachy and modern.It was like it was brand new and so clean.Our cleaning lady Loida was soooo nice and so thorough.We said hi every morning like we were best friends.Loved her.Shes a credit to them as well.Everything is as described and shown on the website.The bed super comfy.The usual teas and coffees and being Australian I asked for and recieved a kettle :) The bathroom was very modern and the toilet and walk in shower was seperate to the vanity.Nice toiletries each day.Quiet rooms.Well mine was anyway.Wi fi was super quick and never dropped out.We had breakfast in the Aroma Cafe.That place was really cute.Very beachy with good service.Lots to choose from and tasted yummy.It overlooks the pool.The pool was nice.Lots of chairs and a few cabanas and the use of free towels.Nice fluffy towels too.Maybe (and just maybe) in summer there could be a little bit more shade.I love the sun but it could get hot around the pool in the arvo.There was a little market shop on site where you could buy food drinks snacks and gifts.Beautiful gifts.Great service in there also :) I used the laundry on the ground floor with no probs.The bell desk organised a shuttle to go to the outlet center and a taxi to the airport.Yeh sure some times the lifts were a touch slow but that didnt worry us.Everyone wants to stay there so its expected to be busy.The location you cant beat-1 street from the beach.Restaraunts and shops all around you.I have been to Waikiki a few times and never had a problem anywhere Ive stayed.If you are thinking of staying here-do it.You wont be disappointed.I recommend it highly and look forward to returning soon.I hope the same people are still working there.Thank you for an AMAZING stay!

This is a great location if you want to be in the middle of Waikiki, a few minutes walk to the beach and lots of shops. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable with a swimming pool and café/ bar at the pool. However the elevators were a complete nightmare they were incredible slow which was very frustrating to say the least.

AMAZING!!! Love this hotel. We stayed here for 8 nights. Family of 7. We had 2 x ocean view rooms with a interconnecting door. Central to everything which made everything easier. Pool isn't large, but we are here in HAWAII!!! beaches and shopping here we come.

Friendly, accomodating staff. I didn’t have high expectations of the rooms but was happily surprised by the interior. contemporary, clean and with a nice feel. But view was absolutely terrible. Loud industrial air conditioners right outside our room. I called reception to ask if they could change our room because it was too loud outside to enjoy the balcony but was advised they could not accommodate my request. Definitely not what I was hoping for on holidays. I have visited numerous countries and all type of accomodation but this was by far the worst view I have ever had. disappointed : ( I would not recommend staying here.

We needed a hotel for one night before we could check into our rental house and the last time I was in Waikiki four years ago I stayed at the Royal Hawaiian. This year it was way out of my price range, so I chose the beachcomber because it was close by. The hotel was amazing. We pulled up to the valet way before check in and they stored our bags and we headed over to the beach to play for a few hours. When we checked in Michael at the desk was so thorough and kind and both my kids commented on how nice he was. The room was clean and well appointed, AC worked great, there were two restaurants in the lobby, a great swimming pool and best of all, less than a 3 minute walk to the beach. Rudy in valet is another staff member I need to commend for his aloha spirit. If your travels bring you to Waikiki do not hesitate to book at the beachcomber.

We were very happy with our stay at this property. Staff were warm and friendly, rooms were quite spacious and very clean. We were right on the Main Street and a short stroll from the beach. Breakfast in on-site Café was very slow but quality was fine. Valet staff and concierge were always helpful and housekeeping in particular were very friendly and helpful.

this hotel was just remodeled. they spent several million dollars. It is located accross from the royal Hawaiian center. It was tasefully decorated and each room had a balcony. The con is the parking and resort fee but it eems like they all are chrging it

We absolutely loved our stay at Beachcomber! It was an amazing first experience to our honeymoon and first trip to Hawaii and Waikiki/Honolulu!! Our room was amazing, we loved how it was in walking distance of the beautiful island views! We definitely have already been talking about going back! It was breath taking, everyone was so friendly and so amazing. This made our honeymoon the best experience ever!!! Thanks so much Beachcomber!

Our stay was very comfortable with the lovely clean room at Waikiki Beachcomber By Outrigger. All staff were lovely and very helpful. The hotel also offer a free trolley service to popular locations in Waikiki. Also provided in the hotel was a great little Cafe, a souvenir/market shop and access into Maui Brewing. Close access to many great eateries in Duke’s Lane and in the International Market Place plus so much more. We would happily recommend this great hotel.

When I pay $250 /day for a hotel I don't expect to need ear plugs to sleep over the noise if the Air Con, and my Waikiki view to be the back wall and roof of the shopping mall next door. Nor do I expect to get stuck in a lift.The hotel (formerly the Holiday inn) has been refurbished so the room have fresh decor and furnishings the infrastructure is still tired (my toilet needed the plumber on arrival).There is a $30 /day resort fee, which covers internet(solid and fast), use of a tram curcuit(once every 1h20m) the pool(15ft x15ft not for swimming) , in room coffee machine, a book of discount vouchers (offers equalled or bettered in store or in other guides) and chilled water in reception.The concierge is employed by expedia so the advise is a tad biased and I found his pricing 10-15% higher than the same event on the expedia web page.Basically.. avoid this one...

A family gathering worked out very well staying at this hotel. It was clean and has been recently refurbished and looks new. The service at the front desk was excellent when we checked in and they all really did look after us and made us feel very welcome. It is a very busy hotel but we thoroughly recommend staying here as the location is perfect and the pool is small but quite nice, has a brewery next door and a cafe that serves snacks and drinks all day.

The hotel has been completely remodeled and as of our stay during the last week of June 2019, and all construction appeared to have been completed. We stayed in the deluxe ocean view room with diamond head view on the 19th floor and the view was stunning. No obstructions, full view of diamond head and waikiki beach from the front of the moana surfrider down to diamond head. The price of a similiar view at a beachfront property would likely be 2-3x more expensive, so that in itself was a great bargain. Street noise dies down around 9-10pm, but unfortunately, there is still a large AC unit for the international marketplace down below and its humming drowns out any sound of waves crashing. We tried to sleep with the sliding door open, in hopes that the sound of waves would come through at some point, but no such luck, and we ended up having to close the door because the hum of the AC unit was just too loud. In Waikiki, I don't think you're going to get the sound of waves in your room unless you are at an oceanfront property - and even then you may have to be in an oceanfront room or room very close to the beach. The rooms are really nicely furnished, nice bathrooms, dual-head showers, brand new very comfy bed. The location is directly across the street from the Outrigger Waikiki Beach, which, in my opinion, is the best stretch of sand on waikiki, so walking to the beach is super easy - less than 5 minutes. The hot tub and pool are recently renovated and good enough. Hot tub is very large and well-heated, so that does the trick. There are some nice day beds on the patio free of charge. The coffee shop in the lobby is also good and convenient. Customer service is great. If you call Outrigger directly to book they are super nice and beat other rates, and they were also incredibly helpful when we had to reschedule our trip due to a family emergency - no change fees and they let us keep the original rate even though we were rebooking on very short notice. The downsides: - From the street you do not enter a lobby, rather, you ride an escalator up to a windowless lobby that, although renovated, doesn't totally give that aloha/hawaiian charm feeling. Not the end of the world.- The way they make you enter and exit with your luggage, down to the street level on elevator rather than taking the escalator needs to be improved -- your first impression entering the hotel is walking down a weird alley past the giant trash dumpsters that absolutely reek in the heat. I honestly can't believe this is the best situation they have devised. It's really off-putting and should be changed. Definitely my biggest complaint with this property. If beachfront properties are out of budget (or you don't want to be staring at the towering hotel next door) and especially if you desire the strip of beach from the Moana Surfrider up to the Royal Hawaiian this is a great option.

Absolutely loved staying in this hotel! Friendly staff, clean rooms and beautiful decor. Our partial ocean view room was priced very well and so worth it! Loved having Hawaiian Aroma Cafe and Maui Brewing Co in the lobby for breakfast or smoothies after a trip to the beach. My husband sampled several of the beers at Maui Brewing, the coconut porter was his favorite, and the bartenders were super nice. Being a one minute walk from the beach and conveniently located next to several restaurants made this location perfect for us. Cannot wait to come back!

This place was perfect for the few nights we were staying in Waikiki. Friendly staff, clean, comfy rooms and close to everything. You could not ask for more.Be warned though, Happy Hour is particularly dangerous with delicious cocktails and nibbles. We may have over indulged once or twice!

This hotel has excellent service. Everyone who worked there was professional and friendly, from the front desk to management to housekeeping.This hotel is not about the views - unless you book a ocean front room. You will see a silver of the beach from a ocean. If you are there to experience the beach then you don't need the view - save the money and walk across the street to the beach and spend the savings on a lounger. There is a small pool because most people are there for the Waikiki beach. The hotel is part of a chain based in Honolulu. I really liked the complimentary slippers since we had to be efficient packers. Nice big room which was kept clean and stocked with toiletries daily. We had an issue with something in the washroom which was promptly addressed. Maui Brewing Company operate a good pub style restaurant in this hotel. Location is excellent on Waikiki beach area - close to everything & lots of ABC stores in the area. This hotel is perfect for the budget minded traveler who wants a good location, clean, modern hotel in Waikiki beach area with excellent service.

Highly recommend this hotel. Great facilities and locality. Outstanding choice of food on offer. High quality clean furnishings, outstanding Friendly and professional customer service. The cleaners are to be commended on their attention to detail and friendliness.

The standard room was too small for a 9 day stay. The room was not located near a ocean view as promised by the website. The hotel was not able to accommodate a late checkout even though the brochure in the room stated the hotel would do everything to accommodate. Hawaii was great but the customer service of the hotel staff was less than to be desired. I would not stay here again!

Stayed in a partial ocean view room with two double beds. We were on the 14th floor and did have a partial ocean view over the Royal Hawaiian hotel in one direction, and of city and mountains the other direction (see pics). The room was tight with 4 of us, but it was really nicely updated and very clean! The mini fridge was nice to have as their is an ABC store close by to grab anything you need. The shower was a nice glass walk in (no tub) with the vanity/sink outside the shower/toilet area so it made it easier for everyone to get ready. The cafe had great breakfast food, and Maui brewing co in the hotel was good but very loud for dinner. The pool is very small but we didn’t care because we weren’t there for the pool. Beach towels were always available and it was a nice short walk across the street to the beach access walkway. Concierge desk was helpful setting up a rental car for us, which was convenient with enterprise being only two blocks away. The location for us was great - across the street from the beach, in the heart of tons of dinning and shopping options, and only $12 Uber to diamond head.The only issue we had was with the elevators. They’re terribly slow and always packed full of people. Only 3 were operational which is not enough for how many people are there. Plan ahead and give yourself a little extra time to wait on the elevators.

Waikiki Beachcomber was our choice of hotel for 7 nights.The location is fantastic, shops restaurants and beach right on your doorstep. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing too much trouble. We stayed in room 2023 where you could see the beach if you leaned over the balcony, not ideal but that’s classed as partial ocean views. Anita our housekeeper was amazing, thank you Anita. Only drawback was flights from Australia arrive early and you can’t checkin until 3pm. We were advised we should have booked from the night before ! Perhaps a half day rate would be more appropriate. If you stay 1 night checkin is 3pm checkout 11am not even 24 hours !!

Staff were helpful. Initially I was put in a partial ocean view room when I arrived, thanks to Autumn for quickly fixing this for me. As part of my solo travel experience, I wanted to make sure I had an ocean view room and view of the street so that's what I understood I had booked when it said 'Ocean View', so my advice is to double check what sort of room you are booking.The other hotel staff I found friendly and helpful, especially the lady who cleaned my room on Level 9 every day, she was lovely.The cafe was great, the Acai bowls are amazing. Busy place after 8.30am, be prepared to wait. Staff friendly but rushed off their feet during the busy period. Yoga class was great although I would suggest running it earlier because once the cafe opened, I couldn't really hear the instructor over the music and talking. It was also strange having other tourists watching and taking photos whilst you are trying to relax and meditate.I would recommend this hotel to my friends. It's central, modern, quiet and affordable. Basic hotel, no frills, but they have obviously made an effort to upgrade it recently.If it rains, they don't provide umbrellas in the room and don't have room service, so a walk in the rain for food is necessary.Also no umbrellas at the pool which meant I couldn't sit down there for long.

Waikiki Beachcomber is minutes walk from the beach and is centrally located in Waikiki surrounded by classic shopping, street shops, and lots of dining options and convenience stores. The hotel is modern and fresh looking, and the rooms are large with a nice size balcony. We got an Ocean View King Size room. It was nice. The one downsize was that on the 14 floor, we could hear loud fans noise from the roof next door while sitting on the balcony. The noise is muted while the baloney door is closed. Friendly staff at the drop off, bell services, front desk, and house keeping. The internet works well. The TV is a large screen flat on the wall. Would definitely stay there again.

Lin L
Indianapolis, Indiana, United States

review_body: This is a nice hotel right in the centre of Waikiki. The hotel is 1 street from the famous Waikiki Beach 3 min walk down dukes lane that is almost across the road from the hotel. We booked a parcel city view room and got a room on the 4th floor not much of a view, all we could see was l the top of the hotel lobby and a few large buildings oh well we didnt spend much time there anyway. Having the Maui Brewery in the hotel was great good food and drinks. The room was clean and well appointed with modern furniture and comfortable bed and pillows. Hot water and fluffy towels. Toiletries were nice and room large and well set out. Reseption staff and service staff very friendly and attentive. Check in and check out easy and fast. Conciege and porters all very helpful and knowledgeable.Lane way next to hotel has a small market place but prices a bit expensive but lane does go through to the next street where there is a lot of restaurants, shops and other stuff. Next door to macys not a large store. Very close to the ABC stores(like a 7eleven) sells everything.A good stay and would definitely recommend.

I travelled with my mother and sister and in the months leading up to our trip, I bombarded the Guest Relations Manager with emails over different things as our mum is elderly and we wanted to make sure we had the right hotel and location. Autumn was fabulous and answered everything with so much grace.The hotel has been renovated beautifully! I did have some trouble with guests through the interconnecting room I was in and within a few days they moved me and all was quiet and peaceful! The front desk staff were also lovely, the housekeeping staff just as good!My only complaint would be the pillows, some iffy behaviour in the pool by a few kids but nothing you couldn’t deal with, a bit more shade would be perfect. I didn’t want to leave, can’t wait to go back hopefully in a few years time. Just go, you won’t regret it!Thanking you all once again for making our stay one not to forget Karen

Have stayed here before when it was The Holiday Inn Beachcomber. What a transformation after a multi-million refurbishment. The rooms are now modern and elegant. Room and bathroom size are still the same but so so much better. The colours used are a sophisticated palette with a beach vibe. The layout of the bathroom area is more functional and appears bigger. Love the tiles used on the floor. Looks like grey wood but is tile. Lots of storage for clothes and baggage. Great size tv above fridge and drawers. Comfy king size bed. Small lounge, table and chair. Lanai/balcony has plenty of room with a table and two chairs. Asked for and got an electric kettle. Much better than the dripolator supplied, for making cups of tea. All staff encountered during the stay, were friendly and helpful. Pool area clean with new lounges and cabanas. Café good for drinks and snacks. Able to access Maui Brewing Company from inside hotel for meals and drinks.Husband's birthday and our 42nd wedding anniversary celebrated during our stay. Thank you for the bottle of bubbles and the chocolates. Lovely surprise.NEGATIVES – 1. Pillows are dreadful. Like logs. Good for support if sitting up in bed watching tv. But awful to sleep on. 2. The lifts are still slow. Excruciatingly slow. Apparently, a new system is being installed at some stage. 3. The new Marketplace shop wasn’t open. Still being worked on. 4. Unable to charge café purchases back to hotel. Cash or credit card only. Don’t like taking cash or cc’s to the pool. A theft waiting to happen. 4. Not enough shade around pool. Only 5 cabanas available. At least 2 more could be accommodated. Some shade cloth over the pergolas would be a great addition. Still leaves plenty of room in full sun for those who wish to bake themselves silly and risk skin cancer. 5. Resort Fees – used nothing except for beach bag. Waste of time and money. Rather get a credit to spend at café or marketplace shop. Or better yet, no resort fees! 6. Changed the brand of toiletries in bathroom. Used to have coconut and lime (my favourite). Am hoping they may stock it when new marketplace shop opens.Negatives aside – it was a great stay. Hotel is fabulous and in a great location. Right across the road from The Cheesecake Factory. Above Macy’s. Shops and restaurants abound nearby. Perfect. Totally recommend. Will stay again.

This hotel has recently been renovated with spacious room. Very convenient location with one block away from beach. Resort fee provide some benefits such as fee trolley and shop discounts but would like to see more benefits or reduced resort fee. The stand out for me is the hospitality of all hotel staff. Will definitely stay here again.

We were very happy with our decision to stay at the Beachcomber. We did have similar issues to other reviewers regarding the elevators, air conditioning and shade around the pool ...all of which appear to be addressed by the hotel. Our room was comfortable and quite. Our housekeeper, Anita looked after us and was very welcoming.I was, however, concerned about the amount of single use plastic used. With no glassware available in our room we had the rely on plastic cups which were wrapped in plastic! Such a waste and environmentally unacceptable. Also the lobby area was constantly filled with guests eating takaway food and drinks..something I haven't experienced before staying at an Outrigger hotel.

Booked an 8 night package with Luxury Escapes Australia, which included breakfast, parking, resort fees, Maui Brewing voucher, Outrigger trolley pass. It was good value, however the breakfast voucher to us was a problem as the Aroma Cafe ware a separate business to the hotel and their food and staff needs some attention. The pool area is nice , but needs to be shaded more, very exposed. The spa is also great. However an outdoor shower and foot washing station needs to be installed as some guests think it’s okay to come straight from the beach with sandy feet and get into the pool and spa, hence they are then dirty and you end up sitting on that sand. The rooms have been beautifully renovated and decorated and the housekeeping staff did a wonderful job servicing our room, could not fault. The only problem with the room is the air conditioning, it seems to have a problem with maintaining temperature and kept cutting in and out(yes we did try setting it at different temps), other guests we chatted with also had some problems with their air-con. I am sure the management will sort out these problems as it has only been recently re-opened and taken over as an Outrigger resort. Overall this hotel is in a great location in Waikiki, would stay here again.

The Waikiki Beachcomber has a prime location on Kalakaua Ave. for upscale shopping and restaurants. It has very close and easy beach access. The hotel was remodeled a few months ago and everything is brand new. The Maui Brewing Company restaurant off from the lobby of the the hotel was absolutely fantastic. Rates are reasonable.I'm giving 4 stars because our one bedroom beachcomber suite on the 22nd floor was very hot and stayed hot for our entire 6 night stay. Beware: There ARE NO air vents into the bedroom part of the suite, only the sitting area. The A/C will come on and run ONLY when the room is occupied, which isn't adequate to get it cooled off before bedtime. We called and had 2 giant fans brought into our room which helped but we did not sleep well at night. The 4 elevators are not up to par with the amount of guests. Be prepared to wait behind a long line during peak times.

We stayed here in early June. Room 1606. Was supposed to be a full ocean view room. To me it was partial ocean view and partial diamond head view - two partials don't make a full. The room was functional. Comfy bed, serviceable but small bathroom, small balcony to watch the goings on in Waikiki. They provided plastic and paper cups for tea and coffee, which is a real turn-off. No wine glasses - had to specifically ask for them. Asked for proper cups as well but apparently they don't have them!! Large wall mounted TV where you could cast Netflix. Latest movies cost $20 US- very expensive. Room tip. We were facing the Diamond Head side. Below us is Macy's. On top of Macy's is a set of large air conditioning systems which are quite loud. This makes the room, even this high up , fairly noisy.Had breakfast one time at Maui Brewing company - part of the hotel - eggs benedict pretty good.Overall I would rate 31/2 out of 5. Would I come back. Probably not.

Just got back from a 6 night stay at this hotel. Everything was comfortable except our room was interconnecting and had a gap in door. There was a baby next door. Luckily baby was pretty good or could have been a problem. Had to wait a while for lifts in peak times. The staff were very friendly and the location was great. Really handy to have a laundry in premises. Overall was a really nice place to relax and enjoy Honolulu. Would recommend

Stayed here for two nights in the partial ocean view room (which had a tiny ocean view). Book early to get a competitive price. Great location and only minutes from Waikiki Beach. Unfortunately you had to pay the daily resort fee (for services that should be complimentary). This can’t be avoided since nearly all the big hotels charge this.

With so many other options in Waikiki, I'm surprised this has such great reviews. Yes, it was recently remodeled, so relatively nice. It has a more modern tone to it, but it clearly is not where Outrigger is spending their money. You start noticing cracks in drywall, dirt on the stairs, and other things that you just would not expect in a well run hotel - particularly for the money you might spend. Service was acceptable and friendly, but never did I feel anyone went out of their way to make me feel like a real guest.The 4 elevators are notably slow in getting to you. Expect to wait a minute or 2 each time, regardless of congestion. In the 3 days we stayed there, one of them went out of commission at the lobby, twice. As it was stuck at the lobby, no other elevators would come to the floor and we had to take the stairs, which are unfinished concrete, similar to what you would find in a parking garage.The day of check-in, their phone system was down, so we were unable to call in to determine a good time to arrive and had to drive into the city to find out. The lights on one of our bedside tables were dead (fixed fairly quickly by maintenance after a call) and their Chromecast service was out for our entire 3-day stay (apparently for the second time in 2 weeks). Don't worry though! You can watch one of the 8 TV channels, or pay the low-low price of $15-20 for a single movie..or $10/day to listen to music.Parking is Valet only, and they charge you $40/day - which seems typical, if on the slightly higher end of the normal Waikiki pricing. I would complain about them being valet only, but their team in the parking garage is very fast. Overall, I think the only things that this hotel has going for it is a reasonably competitive room price and a decent location. It would certainly not be my first choice, though.

We stayed here with our 3 kids, was perfect for us, spacious room, great view of the beach and diamond head from our room and a great location for beach, shopping and eating. There are two awesome eateries in the hotel building a coffee shop and Maui Brew Co. The rooms had just been refurbished and were really cool, the photography and art throughout is amazing, would definitely recommend especially for families!

Lovely hotel & the best location. Hotel has just been renovated - very modern, loved the colours. Staff were warm & friendly, everyone more than helpful with any request. The room was very comfortable & very clean .. would recommend a stay & the view from the balcony was awesome. Great cafe & loved the Maui Brewing Co.Concierge extraordinaire, Stacey Ryan, was so helpful organising my tours & helping with transport to a wedding - Stacey was the best & shared so much information. Thank you Stacey! Both Stacey & Malia were great fun, so friendly & glad I met you both .. a big Mahalo.

I recently stayed at this hotel, which was very nice. Good size rooms, nice bathrooms, great views from the balcony.However paying an extra $20 US per night for a resort fee was a bit of a rip off. This hotel is not a resort, the gym was a hotel room fitted out with a few treadmills & the pool was inaccessible because of the lack of shade. Also it was closed at certain times for whatever reason, leaving hotel guests without access. The lifts were a total nightmare, way too long waiting to go up or down. I would recommend this hotel , however I think they need to get rid of the “ resort “ fee.

Great location right in the heart of Waikiki & all the action. A block from the beach! Staff were all friendly. We checked in & found a band aid (plaster) in the room. Blood on pillows. This was rectified as soon as I advised them but it was gross! They have us a box of chocolates to make up for it. We were supposed to get free waters everyday & a couple of days were missed. Other than that it really was a great location. Hotel was neat & tidy!

Very nice hotel with very nice location, 5 minutes from the beach. Rooms are nice and cozy, with big flat TV, small couch and lovely view (from 24th floor). There is open bathroom with shower and toilet behind sliding door. The room was nice and clean. What I didn't like was long minutes waiting for one of four extremely slow elevators. Also, be sure to save some time for ques at the hotel cafee.Overall, nice hotel with good location in the middle of heaven.

My family and I stayed at the Waikiki Beachcomber by Outrigger in April for my birthday weekend and it was Awesome! From the rooms to the service HANDS DOWN! They have truly up'd their game and the completed renovations are gorgeous! We will definitely be staying again soon. Thank you Beachcomber Ohana!

Came back at this hotel after 10 years ago, I'm absolutely happy with this choice!Top notch service from check-in to room service everyone makes you feel welcome.Breakfast is great at the Aroma café & servings at the Maui Brewery. I love the freshnew rooms, bathroom & the pool area although small. Hope to be back next year!

I stayed in the hotel last month while on business and loved it. The hotel had a great vibe about it. The coffee shop in the morning and the bar in the evening were both great and bustling places that gave the hotel a feeling of a great place to be. The lobby is new that made it light and spacious and that feeling continues up to the room. Wifi, clean rooms, comfortable bedding all added up to a great stay. Would now be my go-to place when there next time.
